of the 288 candidate , 286 have higher education , 202 be under 45 year old , and 56 be woman .
turkmenistan have 27 polling station abroad attach to the country 's diplomatic mission .
election take place by the voting of turkmenistan citizen on the basis of a universal , equal and direct suffrage with secret ballot and alternative basis .
the term of office of mp be five year .
for the first time foreign observer and expert , representative from european state and international organization include un , osce , and cis executive committee monitor election in turkmenistan .
voter in turkmenistan begin to cast they ballot at 8 : 00 be local time -lrb- 0300 gmt -rrb- on sunday in the country 's fourth parliamentary election , say report from ashgabat , turkmenistan 's capital .
over 2.5 million turkmen be eligible to vote at more than 2,000 booth in the country , while there be 27 overseas booth .
voting will close at 6 : 00 p.m. local time -lrb- 1300 gmt -rrb- sunday .
in accordance with the country 's election law , there be a total of 125 contituency in the current election and single winner will be elect in each of they for a term of five year .
a total of 288 candidate be vie for the 125 seat in the legislature .
the 4th parliamentary election of turkmenistan end sunday evening as schedule , say report from ashgabat , turkmenistan 's capital .
more than 2,000 booth in 125 constituency in the country be close at 6:00 p.m. local time -lrb- 1300 gmt -rrb- .
the central election and referendum commission declare the election valid .
official election result will be announce within 10 day .
some 2.44 million people , account for some 88.41 percent of the country 's eligible voter , cast they ballot as of 4:00 p.m. local time -lrb- 1100 gmt -rrb- .
under turkmen law , parliamentary election can only be declare valid with a turnout more than 50 percent of eligible voter .
the election attract wide attention as it be hold amid constitutional and justice reform advocate by president kurbanguly berdymukhamedov .
about 40 observer from the unite nation , the organization for security and cooperation in europe and the commonwealth of independent state oversee the election .
this be the first the government allow international observer to supervise the election in turkmenistan .
berdymukhamedov say earlier that the parliamentary election in turkmenistan would show the international community that the country 's democratization process be irreversible with the adoption of a new constitution .
parliamentary election in turkmenistan to be hold on two - party basis .
26 september 2013 , 10 : 00 -lrb- gmt : 00 -rrb- .
parliamentary election in turkmenistan which be plan for december 15 , 2013 , will be hold on a two - party basis , a message from the central commission for election and referenda of turkmenistan say .
representative of the two political party will compete for victory in the parliamentary election .
this will give a powerful impetus to the pre - election campaign and allow the electorate to nominate the most worthy representative for the country legislative body , the message say .
the start of the campaign for this election will be announce on october 5 , 2013 , in turkmenistan .
nomination of candidate for the national parliament will take place from october 16 to november 14 .
registration will run from october 26 to november 20 .
at a meeting of the central election commission it be decide to hold training seminar for representative of political party , public organisation and association , electoral commission and national observer .
it be expect the election will be monitor by national observer and invite international expert and witness from many foreign country and major international organisation and in the first instance , the european union , the cis and the osce .
the mp term of office be five year .
the main current staff be elect in december 2008 .
last year a law on political party be adopt in turkmenistan .
on this basis , a party of turkmenistan industrialist and entrepreneur be establish in august 2012 in ashgabat with the participation of 300 delegate represent enterprise structure from all region of the country .
up till then , the only political organisation , namely the democratic party , head by president gurbanguly berdimuhamedov be register in the country .
in august 2013 the turkmen leader adopt a decision to remove the duty of the chairman of this political structure from himself .
turkmenistan vote sunday in a parliamentary election mean to show that the energy-rich central asian nation be shed its autocratic past , but western observer say nothing have change .
authority say turnout reach 93.87 percent in the election for 288 candidate , all of whom support the policy of president gurbanguly berdymukhamedov in the ex-soviet republic .
vote station be festoon with turkmen flag and picture of berdymukhamedov , the successor of eccentric dictator saparmurat niyazov , who rule turkmenistan for two decade until he death in 2006 .
over 2.5 million people be eligible to vote in the election , hold under the framework of a new constitution approve in september and intend to increase parliament 's power and raise the number of seat from 65 to 125 .
'' i attach hope for the better to these election , especially for we child , '' valentina redzhepova , a official at one of ashgabat 's voting precinct , tell afp .
'' we be wait for border to open even further so more guest can come to we and so we can visit they . '' .
voter , however , appear reluctant to criticise the government .
in gyamus , a village outside the turkmen capital , 25-year-old guzel say she have come to the local polling station to vote and watch she daughter perform in a child 's folk-dance troupe .
'' i vote for we fellow village resident .
he be a experienced person and know village life well , '' she say .
pensioner bayram-aga , a voter in ashgabat , say .
'' i remember the election from the soviet day ... .
people be very active then , it be like a festival .
now it be much quieter . '' .
western observer say niyazov still cast a shadow , despite promise of openness by berdymukhamedov and some move to dismantle the late dictator 's bizarre personality cult .
niyazov 's gold statue still tower over the desert nation 's capital , rotate to face the sun .
'' the facade have change but the foundation remain the same , '' say a western diplomat , who request anonymity .
'' power rest entirely with the president .
he photo appear every day on the front of the papers .
he strictly control the economy and the whole of the media , '' the diplomat add .
new york-based human rights watch say in a assessment last month that turkmenistan have make '' some progress '' but '' remain ... one of the most repressive and authoritarian state in the world . '' .
the election be unlikely to get a clean bill of health from the west , not least as all candidate have stress support for the president while campaigning .
the organization for security and cooperation in europe send eight expert to monitor the poll and draw up a '' internal report . '' .
the group 's spokesman , jen hagen eschenbecher , tell afp that the expert would not be make any public statement on they conclusion .
ninety percent of the 288 candidate come from the democratic party set up by niyazov in place of the communist party , with the other 10 percent come from so-called '' initiative group '' that have little clout .
all candidate be fund by the state , with a ban on other funding .
western journalist have be refuse permission to cover the vote .
foreign election observer will mainly come from the commonwealth of independent state , a post-soviet group with little credibility .
with its enormous natural gas reserve , turkmenistan be central to european effort to diversify gas supplies away from russia .
berdymukhamedov have voice support for give the west more access to turkmen gas .
27 / 09 / 2013 - turkmenistan to hold first - ever parliamentary election on a two - party basis .
publish on friday , 27 september 2013 .
parliamentary election in turkmenistan that be schedule for december 15 of this year will be hold on a two - party basis , for the first time in the country '' s history , accord to the central election commission of turkmenistan .
voter in turkmenistan cast ballot sunday in a parliamentary election hail by the government as a exercise in democracy but dismiss by critic as a sham .
the election of a 125-seat national legislature be the first parliamentary vote in the natural-gas rich central asian nation since the death of longtime autocrat saparmurat niyazov two year ago .
he successor , gurbanguli berdymukhamedov , say the election be a key step in the development of democracy .
but while the seat be contest , only one political party be legally register in turkmenistan , and its opponent have no foothold in politics .
the u.s. and europe be court turkmenistan as they seek to diversify energy source and be watch the vote for sign of change .
turkmen election to have 2 party for 1st time .
2013 - 09 - 26 .

besides the ruling democratic party -lrb- former communist party -rrb- , the party of industrialist and entrepreneur -lrb- pppt -rrb- -- found in 2012 -- will be seek seat in the december 15 election .
parliament have 125 seat .

presently , parliament have one pppt member , who win a vacate seat in akhal oblast in june .
the people of turkmenistan have vote in the first parliamentary election hold after the adoption of a new constitution earlier this year .
the central election commission say that turnout be almost 90 % .
it be the first poll to be hold under president kurbanguly berdymukhamedov , who have promise to end the central asian nation 's international isolation .
the authority say the vote be a important democratic step , but critic question the validity of the process .
almost all of the 288 candidate run for 125 seat in the parliament come either from turkmenistan 's sole political party , the democratic party , or state-affiliated organisation .
all candidate be fund by the state as alternative funding be ban .
ethnic minority , such as the sizeable uzbek community , be not permit to nominate they own candidate .
international observer .
there be no shortage of voter in the parliamentary election in turkmenistan , the former soviet republic which border the caspian sea .
accord to the country 's central election commission the turnout be extremely high .
almost all of the 2.5 million people eligible cast they vote , report say .
state media proudly report that turkmen citizen live abroad be able to vote for the first time at turkmen embassy and consulate .
official be keen to demonstrate that these election be part of turkmenistan 's process of democratisation .
international observer from the organisation for security and co-operation in europe be invite to monitor the poll .
they be not expect to give any formal assessment of the election proceedings .
previously , turkmenistan have a people 's council whose 2,507 member have to be approve by the country 's late ruler , saparmurat niyazov , who die in 2006 after 21 year in power .
the new leader , mr berdymukhamedov , a former dentist , have introduce a number of measure to modernise the gas-rich nation , after year of isolation under he predecessor .
abolish the people 's council and reinstate the country 's parliament be one of they .
however the country remain largely close to the outside world .

voter in reclusive turkmenistan elect a parliament sunday in balloting herald by authority in the natural gas-rich nation as a key step toward democratic standard but dismiss by critic as a sham .
the election come two year after the death of idiosyncratic dictator saparmurat niyazov , which kindle hope here and in the west that the central asian country would gradually roll back its oppressive political regime and introduce greater freedom .
niyazov 's successor , president gurbangulus berdymukhamedov , have revoke some of he more draconian decree and vow to pursue political reform .
but most of the parliamentary candidate be from the only permit political party , and exile opposition activist say the president have fail to live up to he promise .
'' beyond all the pompous declaration , there will be no real change , '' tadzhigul begmedova , director of the turkmenistan helsinkus foundation for human rights , say by telephone from varna , bulgaria .
'' the hope many people have that a new president would open up turkmen society have be shatter . '' .
on the surface , turkmenistan 's political landscape be change .
in september , the rubber-stamp people 's council - a 2,507-member assembly of presidential appointee , town elder and other - vote to abolish itself and cede most of its power to a expand parliament .
but out of the 288 candidate run for the 125 seat sunday , more than half be member of the pro-presidential democratic party of turkmenistan - a political force create out of the ash of the soviet-era turkmen communist party .
non-party candidate have be draw from state-controlled woman 's and veteran ' organization , trade union and a youth group .
the only non-party candidate in the capital , ashgabat , avidly support berdymukhamedov - undermine official claim the poll will offer a wide choice .
'' i will devote all my strength to the honest and righteous support of we esteemed president 's domestic and foreign policy , '' the candidate , regional bureaucrat resulberdy mammedov , say in a campaign statement .
niyazov isolate turkmenistan from the international community and forge a pervasive personality cult .
he call himself turkmenbashi , or father of all turkmen , rename month after himself and he mother , and make he self-penned spiritual tome mandatory reading for student and state employee .
with berdymukhamedov decrease the country 's isolation , government opponent claim the election be aim to appease western country that be eager to win access to its vast natural-gas reserve but wary of its record on democracy and human rights .
the u.s. and european union be seek to lessen russia 's control over export of turkmen gas .
'' this whole spectacle have be arrange for the international community , to show that turkmenistan be follow the path of democratization , '' say begmedova .
while official have extol the vote as a exercise in democracy , there have be little campaigning and little coverage on state-run television , in contrast with the february 2007 presidential election that confirm berdymukhamedov 's role as head of state .
'' there be very few billboard around the city .
with just four day to go before the election , i still do not know who i be suppose to vote for , '' say maral , 45 , a ashgabat resident who decline to give she surname for fear of official intimidation .
un consult turkmenistan on electoral process .
2 october 2013 , 15 : 39 -lrb- gmt : 00 -rrb- .
on october 1 - 2 ashgabat host a seminar organise with the assistance of the unite nation development programme on enhance the electoral system and process in turkmenistan , a statement of the event organiser say on wednesday .
the project be a part of a joint project with the central commission for election and referenda -lrb- cec -rrb- in turkmenistan .

after the seminar , un consultant will submit the country cec guideline for the use of the international standard of election observation in accordance with national legislation .

to I it be too hard . '' .

i have to hear that tape again , '' one juror say .

this way he not harm anyone anymore . '' .

tactical decision .

a sanctuary for dissent in greece ?
greek law keep police away from university , but some fear the immunity clause mean to protect free speech be now be use to harbor bastion of violence .
mask man wield club guard the entrance to the athen polytechnic university , keep watch over the graffiti-covered wall on campus .
nearby street be barricade with the carcass of burnt car , and a huge black banner proclaim '' murderer '' - the rally cry that have bring greece 's youth to the street .
inside , pile of empty gas canister testify to the score of molotov cocktail assemble there recently .
for more than a week , athenian street have be a battleground between police and protester , whose anger be spark by the fatal shooting of a 15-year-old boy by a policeman .
protect by greece 's constitution from police interference , the polytechnic have become the headquarters of the protest movement - and a haven for those wreak havoc on the city 's street .
as greek try to make sense of the chaos - and prepare for another week of protest , range from sit-in to nationwide roadblock - many here be begin to ask whether the asylum law be protect free speech or simply harbor criminal .
'' the university asylum be for the freedom of movement of idea , but not of commitment of criminal action , '' say george bergele , a professor at the polytechnic who be sympathetic to the student ' complaint , but not they harsh tactic .
'' the law about university asylum i believe be a fantastic achievement of the university movement , but we should protect it by not allow criminal offens to happen inside . '' .
the polytechnic hold historic importance for greek .
in november 1973 , student barricade themselves inside in rebellion against the country 's military junta , which have be in power since 1967 .
fearful that the revolt would spread , on nov. 17 the national police move in with tank , kill a still-disputed number of protester .
the junta fall less than a year later .
greece 's new constitution give special status to university and other school , forever bar the police from enter they grounds .
today , the poly-technic and other institution of learn be once again brim with revolutionary zeal .
across athen , high school and university be under occupation by student and other youth angry at the dec. 6 killing of alexandro grigoropoulo and also at a political system they see as corrupt and incompetent .
so far , prime minister costa karamanlis have reject call by opposition leader to hold early election , but he center-right party hold only a one-seat majority in parliament , and public support for he government be weak even before the riot .
the latest poll number show a 20 percent approval rating .
the polytechnic , which lie on the border of the edgy neighborhood of exarchia , where the 15-year-old be kill , be serve as the heart and brain center of the revolt .
there , anarchist - many of whom call exarchia they home - be help to organize student and other young people .
the area just outside its gate have be the site of some of the most intense clash with police .
inside , protester regroup and rearm around bonfire that burn through the night .
there be a air of menace outside the polytechnic .
but stergia sarantopoulou , a architecture student there who have be participate in protest , say the mood be angry but collegial .
like many student , she passionately defend the asylum law .
'' there be historical , political , ideological reason for the immunity to exist , '' she say .
'' university be we home .
it be the student home ; it be the teacher home . '' .
the university safe-haven policy might at time be abuse , ms. sarantopoulou say , but in the long run society be better off by have a law that forever ensure a safe place for free speech .
'' it be much more harmful for the state to control -lsb- university , -rsb- '' she say .
the explosion of rioting and looting that take place in the aftermath of alexandro 's death have fade in recent day , but there be still daily protest , many of which end in hail of rock and flaming molotov cocktail .
on saturday , the one-week anniversary of the shooting , the protest be largely peaceful , though still angry .
in daylight , a fragile normality begin to return to the city center , with shop again open and people return to work .
but at night , uncertain athenian stay away from the normally bustling city center , which be ghostly quiet .
group of young people roam the street across central athen , shout .
'' this night be for alexi ! '' .
a heavy cloud of tear gas and smoke hang over exarchia , which feel like a rebel-held enclave in a city at war .
police linger warily on its edge as young people set up burn barricade and attack government building and bank .
and clash erupt once again outside the polytechnic .
few here think the unrest will end anytime soon , and the rage of greece 's youth continue to smolder .
the death of alexandro 's have tap into anger about a range of broader complaint - about corruption , nepotism , a fail education system , and the poor economic prospects of young people , include unemployment rate in the 25 percent range .
protest be expect to continue throughout the week , with activist call for road to be block nationwide on tuesday .
they say they want to bring down greece 's whole political system - it be not just the current government that be see as tainted , most believe the main opposition be little better .
the protester , however , struggle to articulate exactly what they want in its place .
'' do not bend you head down , '' they chant as they confront police recently in front of parliament .
'' the only way be resistance . '' .

first come the shooting : a armed teenager kill by police officer on a darkened brooklyn street .

two officer suffer minor injury .

for other , it be anything but reassure .
the police say that two plainclothes officer fatally shoot the teenager , kimani gray , just before 11 : 30 p . m . on saturday after he brandish a revolver and point it at they .

seven bullet hit mr . gray , include three that enter he body from the rear , accord to the new york city office of the chief medical examiner .

but the finding , inconclusive though they be , appear likely to heighten the tension of a community already distrustful of the police and increasingly incensed about the shooting of the teenager .

ellen degenere to host oscar .
august 2 , 2013 | 08 : 06am pt .
talkshow host return for second oscar tour .
and the next host of the academy award be ... ellen degenere .
it will be degenere '' second tour of duty as oscar host , have previously emcee the 79th annual academy award in 2007 and earn a emmy nomination .
the popular syndicate talkshow host also front the emmy in 2001 and 2005 -lrb- co - host they in 2003 -rrb- .

over the last eight year , the 2007 oscar host by degenere stand as the top rate in both adult 18 - 49 -lrb- 14 . 1 rating / 33 share -rrb- and woman 25 - 54 -lrb- 19 . 2 / 40 -rrb- .
even as oscar organizer on friday unveil hugh jackman as the host of they gala film award , the prospect of a u.s. actor strike be cast a long shadow over whether hollywood 's big show would go on as usual .
the academy award ' february 22 date put it directly in the path of a potential walkout by screen actor guild member who vote next month on whether to give union leader permission to call a strike in stalemate contract talk with major studio .
movie making by the big studio have wind down since late june in anticipation of labor strife , compound a general slowdown from the u.s. recession .
the tension have only be heighten by fatigue from a tumultuous 14-week hollywood writer strike that end in february and cost the lo angele area economy around $ 3 billion as production stop on most prime-time tv show .
'' a strike , if one occur , would be nothing short of horrible , '' say ron howard , the former actor and oscar-winning director of '' a beautiful mind '' whose latest film , '' frost/nixon , '' be consider a strong oscar contender .
'' the timing could not be worse , '' he say on thursday .
actor leonardo dicaprio , who on thursday earn a golden globe nomination for he work in '' revolutionary road , '' say strike concern be hit '' everyone . '' .
'' it be really important that we come up with a solution , '' he say .
'' these be unheard-of time , and no one can predict what be go to happen '' with the u.s. economy .
sag 's dark cloud .
the oscar , give out by the academy of motion picture art and science , be annually hollywood 's glitziest night .
put the show in jeopardy , however , be this week 's announcement by sag that strike authorization ballot will be mail to its 120,000 member on january 2 and tally on january 23 , a full month before the oscar .
that sequence of event raise the prospect of a-list star boycott the honor to avoid cross they own union 's picket line -- or even carry picket sign themselves .
the same dynamic come into play last january when a work stoppage by 10,500 writer guild of america member throw the award season into disarray and cause the star-filled golden globe award to be replace by a news conference .
only 5.8 million tv viewer tuned-in , far below the globe ' typical 20 million audience .
broadcaster nbc lose a estimate $ 10 million to $ 15 million in advertising revenue .
the writer strike be settle a month later , spare the academy award and its network , abc , a similar fate .
but this time around , the oscar be on the firing line and australian actor jackman , star of the '' x-men '' movie as well as broadway stage show , may himself have to pull out .
'' at this point , we be move forward with all of we plan to do we show , and of course we be monitor what be go on , '' say academy spokeswoman leslie unger .
sag leader say they need a credible strike threat to wrest a better contract deal from the studio than the '' final '' offer management present before talk collapse on june 30 .
they stress , however , that a '' yes '' vote do not automatically put a strike into effect , and it remain uncertain whether sag can muster the support it need -- 75 percent of those voting -- to pass its authorization .
talk collapse over issue that include how much actor would get pay for work on the internet , and the financial impact of a possible strike on hollywood remain unclear .
most film slate for release in 2009 already have be shoot , mean the 2010 slate would see the brunt of a strike .
some tv prime-time dramas and sitcom will have complete production before sag a work stoppage , though a walkout could hinder development of new series for fall 2009 .

new york woman kill in hit - and - run crash .
on behalf of howard r . sander , esq . post in pedestrian accident on wednesday , september 18 , 2013 .
accord to investigator , a woman be kill by a hit - and - run driver in queen on the night of sept . 13 .
at approximately 7 p . m . , the woman be walk near the intersection of 117th street and 97th avenue in richmond hill .
she be walk among some park car when she be hit by a grey toyota camry that have be travel north on 117th street .
the driver flee the accident scene but be apprehend by police officer .
the driver be charge with dwi , leave the scene of a accident result in death , criminally negligent homicide and vehicular manslaughter .
a hit - and - run accident may be consider a example of extreme recklessness or carelessness on the part of a driver .
a personal injury attorney might review a hit - and - run accident case and suggest seek punitive damages .
in some instance , it be possible to collect damages that exceed compensation for lose wages , medical expense and funeral cost .
the intention be to punish reckless and negligent driver and also to send a message to other driver .
if the family wish to seek only compensation for accident - related expense , the attorney may negotiate for a settlement outside of court .
on the other hand , if the family decide to seek punitive damages , the attorney might request a jury trial in civil court .
if the at - fault driver be charge or convict in criminal court , it may help support the claim of recklessness .
the attorney may use police report , photo and evidence to build a convincing argument on behalf of the family .
if the judge and jury be persuade by the argument and evidence present , they may find in favor of the plaintiff and award punitive damages .

on behalf of newman , anzalone & newman , llp . post in hit and run accident on friday , september 20 , 2013 .
in new york , there be law about what to do if you have be involve in a accident .
one extremely important law be that both driver must remain at the scene of the crash if someone be injure or kill .
this law help make sure that no one be leave behind to try to get help on they own .
unfortunately , some people be too afraid of the other potential consequence of a serious crash that they choose to flee the scene , leave victim to fend for themselves .
this type of negligence can lead to a delay in treatment , which could result in death .
just last week , a serious hit - and - run accident take place in queen .
when a 59 - year - old woman step out of she car at 97th avenue and 117th street , she be strike by a car .
instead of stop to help she , however , the driver flee the scene .
sadly , the mother of two die from injury she sustain in the crash .
thankfully , a police officer be nearby and see the collision .
he chase down the driver and eventually arrest he .
the driver be charge with drunk driving , leave the scene of a accident result in death , and vehicular manslaughter .
for victim injure in a hit - and - run accident and the family member of those who be kill by hit - and - run driver , the aftermath of such accident can be very difficult to deal with .
on top of try to recover from injury or grieve the loss of a love one , many people wonder how they will be able to obtain compensation for cost incur due to the accident .
even if you not know who hit you , there be way to obtain compensation for the damages inflict in a hit - and - run crash .
whether you work with a attorney to find the driver or pursue compensation through you personal injury protection coverage , there be way to make sure you get the financial help you need after a accident .

vincent gigante -lrb- pronounced ji - gant - tee -rrb- be bear on march 29 , 1928 , in new york city and grow up on the same street in greenwich village where he would spend most of he adult life .
he be one of five son of salvatore gigante , a watchmaker , and yolanda gigante , a seamstress , both of whom have immigrate from naple .
he mother usually address he as cincenzo , '' a diminutive of vincente , and he boyhood friend shorten that into he lifelong nickname , chin . '' .
a lackadaisical student , mr . gigante graduate from p . s . 3 , a elementary school in greenwich village and drop out of textile high school in manhattan in the ninth grade .

he only jail sentence in that period be 60 day for a gambling conviction .
when arrest in he early 20 , he list he occupation as a tailor .
but as a strapping youth with quick fist , he be better know as a prize fighter .
mr . gigante , from age 16 to 19 , fight as a light heavyweight in club around town , win 21 of 25 light - heavyweight bout , accord to nat fleischer ring record book .
club boxer in those day fight four - and six - round contest in neighborhood arena , usually get a percentage of the ticket they themselves sell .
one of mr . gigante manager be a greenwich village neighbor , thoma -lrb- tommy ryan -rrb- ebolus , who later become the boss of the genovese family .
former new york city detective who be assign to organize - crime intelligence unit say that mr . gigante earn he mafia spur as a enforcer in the 1950 .
but he prominence in the underworld surge in 1957 , when mr . genovese wrest control of a mob family from frank costello , who have be a close friend of lucky luciano and meyer lansky and be one of the best - know underworld figure in america .
mr . costello retire abruptly as a boss after a gunman graze he scalp with a bullet in the vestibule of he apartment building on central park west .
a doorman identify the 29 - year - old mr . gigante as the shooter , but mr . costello testify that he be unable to recognize he assailant and mr . gigante be acquit in 1958 on charge of attempt murder .
a year later , he be convict with mr . genovese in manhattan on federal charge of heroin trafficking .
mr . gigante , who list he profession as the superintendent of a tenement on bleecker street , be sentence to seven year in prison .
the sentencing judge say he would have impose a longer sentence but be sway by a flood of letter from resident of greenwich village and little italy attesting to mr . gigante good character and he work on behalf of juvenile .

although he headquarters be in lower manhattan and he spend he night farther uptown , mr . gigante have a home in old tappan , n . j . , where he live with he wife , the former olympia grippa , and they three daughter and two son .
they be yolanda fyfe , roseanne d'cola and rita gigante , and salvatore and andrew .

the accusation be drop after mr . gigante lawyer present report from psychiatrist that he be mentally unfit to stand trial .

genovese soldier and associate be forbid to utter he name or nickname in conversation or telephone call .

mr . gigante be indict in 1990 with 14 other on federal charge in brooklyn that they have conspire to rig bid and extort payoff from contractor on multimillion - dollar contract with the new york city housing authority to install window .

microsoft release critical patch for ie zero day flaw .
microsoft -lrb- nsdq : msft -rrb- issue a out-of-band emergency patch wednesday for a zero-day internet explorer vulnerability that have open the door for hacker to install malware on susceptible computer without any user intervention .
the flaw , which be give the highest severity rating of critical , affect all version of microsoft 's ie web browser .
specifically , microsoft 's ie update affect version of window 2000 for ie 5.01 : xp , xp professional , server 2003 for ie 6 ; and xp , server 2003 , vista , server 2008 for ie 7 .
the vulnerability be report after the release of window ie 8 beta 2 , but microsoft still recommend in its advisory that user apply the patch .
the ie security problem be the result of a fundamental flaw in the browser 's datum binding function , which ultimately leave a hole in the memory space that can be access by remote hacker .
internet explorer can then quit unexpectedly while in a exploitable state .
unlike other exploit , user have only to visit a malicious site infuse with trojan or other malware in order to become infected .
hacker can also entice victim to visit a specially craft site , usually via some kind of phishing or social engineering scheme , or place infected banner ad on legitimate web site .
once user open a infected web page , malicious downloader be then install on they computer , which be design to record keystroke and steal password , credit card number , or other financial information .
the user ' computer could also become part of a botnet , a infected network of compromise computer , operate by a central command and control center .
security researcher first see evidence of attack exploit the ie vulnerability last week , shortly follow microsoft 's '' patch tuesday '' monthly security bulletin release dec. 9 .
since then , researcher have see active exploitation rapidly spread in the wild .
while exact number of victim be difficult to precisely calculate , the number of infected computer could potentially affect hundred of thousand or million of computer , expert say .
'' there be people constantly look at the code , try to find issue like -lrb- the ie vulnerability -rrb- , '' say dave marcus , security research and communication manager for mcafee .
'' it get post to the internet very quickly . '' .
mcafee avert lab researcher report variant of the ie exploit that attempt to infect user via a activex control that store the malicious exploit code , stealthily run in the background of a microsoft word document .
malware be then install on the vulnerable computer once user open up a word document -- all without they knowledge or permission .
'' we have see some pretty clever way of people try to take advantage of this , '' say marcus .
'' it just speak to the fact that they look for clever , very unique way to get malware onto you system . '' .
security expert strongly recommend that user apply microsoft 's latest ie patch as soon as possible , which can be download from the microsoft web site .

microsoft launch emergency patch for internet explorer .
microsoft have just release a new security update for internet explorer in order to patch a flaw affect all version of the company '' s in - house browser , include ie11 on window 8 . 1 rtm .
while microsoft claim that it have receive report of attack aim at internet explorer 8 and 9 , it appear that the security flaw affect all the other version of the browser .
accord to the company , the issue would allow remote code execution , which mean that a attacker could get access to a unpatched system by direct user to a compromise website .
'' this issue could allow remote code execution if a affected system browse to a website contain malicious content direct towards the specific browser type .
this would typically occur when a attacker compromise the security of trust website regularly frequent , or convince someone to click on a link in a email or instant message , '' the company explain .
the fix it tool release by microsoft can be use for ie6 , 7 , 8 , 9 , 10 , and 11 on window xp , vista , 7 , 8 , and 8 . 1 , both preview and rtm . 32 - and 64 - bit version of the operating system be all include in the security advisory .
in addition , the tech giant recommend user to set internet and local intranet security zone setting to '' high '' in order to block activex control and active script in these zone .
'' this will help prevent exploitation but may affect usability ; therefore , trust site should be add to the internet explorer trust site zone to minimize disruption , '' microsoft say .
at the same time , the softie suggest that it would be a good idea to configure internet explorer to prompt before run active scripting or to disable active script completely in the internet and local intranet security zone , just to be sure that everyone be on the safe side and no successful attack be possible .

the pass yesterday of w. mark feel , the man who be the infamous secret source for washington post reporter bob woodward and carl bernstein during they investigation of the watergate scandal , mark the end of a life that bring about both the good and the bad of anonymous source in political journalism .
without feel 's information , the full scale of the nixon administration 's corruption would likely never have come to light , he would not have resign in disgrace , and it might have set a precedent that the president of the united state be above the law .
deep throat also give we a new archetype in popular culture : the shadowy insider in a trench coat , call up reporter for secret meeting in parking garage to spill the dirt , often with gravely voice and cautious look over the shoulder .
it be be employ in entertainment ever since , from hal holbrook 's performance as deep throat in all the president 's man , to fox mulder 's informant in the x-files , to even the caped crusader give vickus vale the cure for the joker 's poison gas in batman .
but the downside of feel 's legacy be the increase willingness of modern day journalist to grant anonymity to source at the drop of a fedora .
i have be a avid reader of political news for ten year now and lose count of how many story be attribute to someone , '' who decline to be name because they be not authorize to speak on the matter , '' or , '' who decline to be name for fear of anger the president . '' .
it be become a lazy reporter 's default set to allow people to talk on '' deep background , '' and as a result we have slip into a rut where accountability in government have become a rare , almost non-existent concept .
all journalist should pore over the many obit of feel today and think long and hard about they duty to the public the next time someone ask to go off the record .

feel decide to cooperate with he and set up a elaborate system of espionage technique for clandestine meeting with woodward .

w. mark feel , who remain anonymous for more than three decade as the source know as '' deep throat '' in the 1972 watergate scandal that topple richard nixon 's presidency , have die .
feel die at he home in santa rosa , california , thursday , the press democrat newspaper report , cite feel 's grandson nick jone .
feel provide tip and information that guide washington post reporter bob woodward and carl bernstein as they write story stem from the bungle burglary of the democratic party national committee headquarters in 1972 .
president nixon ultimately resign as a consequence of the white house role in the scandal and in the cover-up that follow .
the identity of feel , a former associate director at the federal bureau of investigation , remain a secret until may 2005 , when woodward and bernstein confirm revelation publish in a article in the july issue of vanity fair .
'' because of he position virtually atop the chief investigative agency , he word and guidance have immense , at time even staggering , authority , '' woodward say in a article in the washington post on june 2 , 2005 .
the story of '' deep throat , '' a name borrow from the title of a 1972 pornographic film , assume legendary status as academic and history buff clamor to unlock the enigma that play a role in nixon 's resignation in 1974 .
as early as october 1972 , nixon himself voice suspicion that feel may be leak information to the press and attorney general richard kleindienst have pressured fbi act director l. patrick gray to fire he deputy .
feel deny he role repeatedly and stay at the fbi until he retirement in june 1973 .
'' the thing that stun I be that the goddamn secret have last this long , '' ben bradlee , who oversee almost 400 story on watergate when he be the washington post 's executive editor , say after the may 2005 revelation .
although he know the paper 's source be a high-ranking government official , bradlee do not find out feel 's name until nixon resign .
feel be one of many people rumor to be '' deep throat . '' .
other include alexander haig , nixon 's white house chief of staff ; former national security adviser henry kissinger ; fred fielding , assistant to white house counsel john dean ; and george h.w. bush , the u.s. ambassador to the unite nation at the time .
speculation also surround former u.s. supreme court chief justice william rehnquist , whose poor health coincide with unfounded report that '' deep throat '' be gravely ill .

fallout continue after brazen escape .
the texas department of criminal justice have make sweeping leadership change at a huntsville prison where a inmate manage to get a gun that he later use to escape , the agency announce tuesday .
the nov . 30 escape by arcade joseph comeaux jr . , a convict rapist recapture last month after eight day on the run in baytown and houston , have lead to unprecedented fallout at the prison unit where he be house , with the largest number of tdcj employee ever face termination or disciplinary action because of a single incident , say tdcj inspector general john moriarty .
comeaux , 49 , escape from a prison van in baytown after he pull a gun on two tdcj officer drive he to another prison in beaumont .
he be at large until dec . 7 , when he be find shoeless , wet and hungry at a north houston business , where he ask to use the phone .
so far , 11 estelle unit employee have be recommend for termination or face consequence related to comeaux escape .
four of those elect to retire instead of face disciplinary action , include the two officer who drive comeaux in the van on the day he escape .
whitmire question why several prison , include the estelle unit , stop search visitor two month before comeaux escape and move to random pat - downs .
since comeaux jailbreak , all visitor and employee at the estelle prison unit be again subject to mandatory pat - downs , lyon say .
after more than three year and a tangled trail of frustrating legal delay , the man who kill four people in a brazen courthouse escape be sentence saturday to prison for life without parole and hundred of year more .
yet prosecutor who spend the last month urge juror to sentence one of atlanta 's most notorious criminal to death be not celebrate .
'' the community have speak , '' fulton county district attorney paul howard say at a emotional press conference after the sentencing of brian nichol .
'' even though we be puzzle and terribly disappoint by the decision , we must accept the conclusion provide by we community . '' .
it show how difficult it be to get a capital sentence in atlanta 's fulton county , where death penalty be rare even in a state where support for capital punishment be widespread .
georgia tie for third in carry out execution last year .
and it underscore the problem georgia prosecutor say they frequently face with the requirement that death sentence can only be return by unanimous jury verdict .
nichol , 37 , be find guilty last month of murder a judge , a court reporter , a sheriff 's deputy and a federal agent in the march 2005 rampage .
after four day deliberate on whether to recommend the death penalty , the jury deadlock at 9-3 .
nichol will likely die in prison after superior court judge jame bodiford hand down the maximum prison sentence on each of 54 charge .
the deadlock devastate prosecutor , who have turn down a offer from nichol ' attorney to plead guilty in exchange for a life sentence .
the trial have already cost more than $ 2 million , likely the most expensive in state history .
and it may not be over yet .
howard say he be talk to the u.s. attorney about a federal death penalty trial for the federal agent 's slaying .
in the meantime , howard and some state legislative leader say georgia 's death penalty rule should be change .
'' georgia be a conservative state , but there be pocket where it be not , '' say state rep. barry fleming , a republican who lead a fail bid last year to allow judge to approve death penalty even if one or two juror vote against it .
'' there be people who will attempt to nullify the law when they get on the jury . '' .
the last time a fulton county jury issue a death sentence be eight year ago , and only then for a triple murderer who kill a toddler .
one factor could be race .
the county be 43 percent black , and numerous poll and survey have find that black be more likely than whites to oppose capital punishment .
eight of the juror be black .
the three who vote against the death penalty would not comment , but howard say other juror tell he the three holdout refuse to deliberate .
he say he be tell that one be wear headphone during the closed-door discussion this week .
two juror who speak at howard 's news conference but decline to be identify say they work hard to try to reach a verdict .
'' i believe brian nichol do not win .
in he own word , he say it be not he dna to stay in jail , which be what he have to look forward to the rest of he life , '' say christina greenway , daughter of slay court reporter julie ann brandau .
'' i be not disappointed and i have no regret . '' .
nichol be be escort to he trial for rape when he overpower a deputy guard he and steal she gun .
he burst into the courtroom and shot and kill superior court judge rowland barne , brandau and sheriff 's deputy hoyt teasley .
he flee downtown atlanta and manage to evade hundred of police officer search for he overnight .
in atlanta 's posh buckhead neighborhood , he shoot and kill federal agent david wilhelm at a house the agent be renovate .
death penalty expert say the nichol verdict show there be no tell what will happen when a jury be ask to settle a capital case .
'' it be very hard for 12 people to sit down around the table to make a decision to put another human be to death , '' say stephen bright , a yale law school lecturer and a veteran capital defense attorney .

about the prison .
the supermax unit at the florence federal correctional complex at florence , colo. , primarily hold extremely dangerous or escape-risk federal inmate .
there also be a few state prisoner there who need more security than those prison can provide .
the remote prison , which open in 1994 , almost disappear into the same-color desert around it .
cell be 8-by-12 foot , with concrete wall , ceiling and furnishings , include the bed .
the toilet , sink and shower be stainless steel .
cell window be long and narrow , limit the view to only the sky .
some known inmate .
unabomber ted kaczynskus , shoe bomber richard reid , and sept. 11 , 2001 conspirator zacaria moussaouus .
jamil abdullah al-amin , the 1960 militant once name h. rap brown , convict in georgia of the state crime of murder a fulton county deputy .
convict of federal crime in georgia : eric robert rudolph , who plead guilty to the centennial olympic park bombing and other bombing in atlanta , and malachi z. york , the nuwaubian leader convict of child molestation , racketeering and federal financial reporting charge .
prison program .
a three-step program limit - or perhaps deprive - inmate of many thing that would stimulate the sens - smell , sight and touch .
olympic park bomber rudolph complain in letter to a colorado newspaper in 2006 that the prison 's design be drive he insane .
in the first stage of the program , inmate spend 23 of every 24 hour double-locked behind a steel door and a bar grate .
they be allow one 15-minute telephone call a month .
one hour each day be spend alone in a recreation area .
they behavior be review every 90 day before they can be move up to the next step .
at the second and third step , inmate be give progressively more freedom , more time for exercise , longer and more frequent telephone call and more social contact with other prisoner - as long as they be free of violation .
limited inmate privilege .
inmate get a radio and a black-and-white , 13-inch television make specially with clear back that reveal all internal component .
the tv be hook up to '' basic cable . '' .
inmate participate in religious service that be broadcast on they television .
guard pass inmate ' meal , law book and other item through a slot in the door .
there be limited direct human contact .

sever cable in mediterranean disrupt communication .
internet and telephone communication between the middle east and europe be disrupt after three submarine cable between italy and egypt in the mediterranean sea be damage .
the failure cut the flow of '' datum of various kind '' between europe and the middle east , and there be no timeframe for when communication will be restore , say sanjeev gaur , director of assurance at reliance globalcom ltd. in india .

three cable system carry more than 75 percent of traffic between the middle east , europe and america have be damage , accord to the u.k. 's interoute plc , which operate a fiber optic datum network connect 92 city .
the cable run from alexandria in northern egypt to sicily in southern italy .
in january , a anchor sever the cable outside alexandria after bad weather condition force ship to moor off the coast .

hansbrough break unc 's career score record the carolina way .
during the spring of 1977 , north carolina coach dean smith invite he star guard phil ford , who have just complete he junior season , into he office .
smith tell ford that he have do some research on where ford would be select in the upcome nba draft base on that information , he recommend to ford that he leave school .
ford do not even have to think about it .
he tell smith right away that he be not interested .
'' at the time , a lot of people be not do that , so go pro be not something i have even consider at all , '' ford say .
'' the financial situation be different back then as well .
at the time , my parent be teacher , so get my degree be very important to I .
the opportunity be not worth I not get my degree . '' .
last april , tyler hansbrough face a similar decision , but under much different circumstance .
hansbrough play in a era when not only be it common for undergraduate to turn pro , but in some circle a player be consider a failure if he stay past he junior year .
needless to say , he face a financial opportunity much greater than the one ford confront three decade ago .
hansbrough spend two full week torture himself over the impending decision .
when hansbrough finally tell roy william he want to return for he senior year , he feel like the weight of the world be off he shoulder .
he be so relieved that he do not even leave the weight room when william ask he to come to he office so they could craft a press release .
'' it be a stressful process , '' hansbrough say in mid-october .
'' you be think about what you be go to do with the rest of you life .
every time i think about leave , i think about how much i would miss come home , live with my teammate and do a lot of the fun thing we do .
i just feel like come back would be the best situation for I . '' .
in consider that life decision , it be doubtful hansbrough give much thought to the chance he would have to become north carolina 's alltime score leader if he return .
still , give the century 's worth of tradition that have reign in chapel hill , it be no small feat that hansbrough accomplish thursday night , when he break ford 's school career score mark with less than eight minute to play in the first half of north carolina 's game against evansville .
north carolina have establish itself as the gold standard of college basketball , and in the soft-spoken , hard-charging , 6-foot-9 power forward from poplar bluff , missouri , this proud program have a worthy standard bearer .
ford be correct when he say that people be not appreciative enough of hansbrough 's skill , but there be no doubt that what set this young man apart be the intensity with which he play .
if ford be a classical symphony , hansbrough be a heavy metal rock concert , power , jostle , bang , and always , always out-hustle he opponent en route to the basket .
it be instructive that while hansbrough remain ninth on the acc 's alltime score list , he be already the league 's career leader in free throw attempt .
if he stay healthy , he will likely leave north carolina as the school 's alltime rebound king .
more than anything , though , tyler hansbrough deserve this record because he come back to school .
this be not to disparage player like michael jordan , antawn jamison and rashad mccant who might have have a shot at ford 's mark have they stay .
but at a place like north carolina , which embody team play , the score record should belong to a four-year player .
hansbrough would probably not have be a top-five draft pick have he leave , but it be unlikely he will signifcantly improve he draft status by play another year .

tectonic summary - maacama fault .
the maacama fault be mostly a right - lateral strike - slip fault that lie north of santa rosa and the immediate san francisco bay area and extend as far north as ukiah .
it connect to the rodger creek fault through a complex set of fault between santa rosa and healdsburg , and be think to be the northward continuation of the hayward - rodger creek fault system .
the 2007 work group for california earthquake probability assign a total slip rate on the maacama fault of approximately 9 mm / yr -lrb- 1 / 3 inch / yr -rrb- , base on the assumption that it continue the slip on the hayward - rodger creek fault northward .
the central and northern section of the fault have be observe to accommodate approximately 7 mm / yr -lrb- 1 / 4 inch / year -rrb- of creep along it .
the maacama fault parallel and overlap the rodger creek fault , in a geometry that be cause the ground between the fault to subside .
in sonoma county north of healdsburg , the maacama fault be largely obscure by massive landslide where it pass east of alexander valley .
the 2007 work group for california earthquake probability combine the maacama and the garberville fault into single a 181 - km -lrb- 110 mile -rrb- long fault and determine m7 . 5 as the maximum magnitude for this combined fault system .
there be very little known about the seismic history or earthquake cycle of the maacama fault , and as such recurrence interval be uncertain .

the announcement come sunday , after month of public speculation and wish - listing , conspiratorial sifting of coincidence and reading of tea leave , near the end of doctor who live : the next doctor , '' a bbc special that air here simultaneously on bbc america .
it be not to be confuse with the big 50th anniversary special set for november .
with fifth doctor peter davison -lrb- the cricket - sweater doctor -rrb- and elderly companion bernard cribben as its main in - studio star power and a float tardis -lrb- police - box shaped time machine , for the uninitiated -rrb- introduce as a special guest , '' it be , global interest aside , a small - scale , essentially local , even provincial , event .
because whatever else the new doctor would turn out to be - and , if recent history be any guide he would turn out to be tall , thin , white , clean - shaven , not bald and unconventionally attractive -lrb- check , check , check , check , check and check -rrb- - it be go to be somebody british .
as do jame bond , doctor who posit a world in which the u . k . be still at the center of thing .
it where the alien arrive , and the earth be repeatedly save .
some have hope for a black doctor -lrb- idris elba be often name -rrb- , or a female doctor -lrb- olivia colman , perhaps -rrb- , and as with other great and important office , it do seem only right that it be open to anyone , regardless of gender or color .
indeed , if it seem just possible this time , it hard to believe the next doctor not break one of those line , or both .
that capaldi be a award - win actor of great reputation do not necessarily mean that it will be any easier for he to take control of the tardis .
every new doctor represent a testing of the brand and a testing of the faithful ; there be viewer still mourn the loss of david tennant -lrb- no . 10 -rrb- , and undoubtedly some who feel nothing be as good since tom baker -lrb- no . 4 -rrb- quit , back in 1981 .
it be also , and not incidentally , a test of the show runner , steven moffat , who come in with smith , follow series - rebooter russell t davy .
show runner be a thing we know about now ; we know whom to blame , and moffat draw a fair share .
still , first reaction seem on the whole approve , though some younger online commenter bemoan capaldi age - 55 , the age of william hartnell when he create the role , back in 1963 .
fangirl who crush on the younger eccleston , tennant and / or smith wonder how they would adapt to a doctor old enough to be they dad .
there be , of course , plenty of precedent for gray - hair swashbuckler -lrb- you gandalf , actually call gray , you obi - wan kenobus , you very vibrant third doctor , john pertwee -rrb- .
and moffat can always create companion for raw youth appeal , as be the original custom .
-lrb- hartnell doctor travel with a granddaughter . -rrb- .
certainly , capaldi represent a change from matt smith - think by some to be too young for the part when he take over , ironically - but he also offer a range of new tonal possibility , some of which be also old possibility .
moffat may be more of a who classicist than davy , who bring sex , romance and a will - they - not - they element to the series .
it may be time for the return of a more fatherly doctor .
if you look back across the whole life of the series , capaldi seem very much in the tradition - a likely , almost obvious choice .
he have the authority , the madness , the sweetness .
at the same time , we not know how moffat plan to write he .
the doctor be as constant as the star and as changeable as the wind ; he be a warrior clown , comical and stern , a thousand - year - old child , a tenderhearted soul who love humanity and yet be renown across the universe as the scourge of world .
-lrb- typically , these be world that deserve a scourge . -rrb- .

in addition , apple stun the industry by say this year would be its last appearance at macworld .

buyer also have the option of a 2.93-ghz core 2 duo processor .
but the most innovative feature in the upgrade be a new battery that apple claim will last up to eight hour on a single charge and can be recharge up to 1,000 time , which mean up to a five-year lifespan .
rivalsdell -lrb- dell -rrb- and hewlett-packard -lrb- nyse : hpq -rrb- last year introduce laptop with similar battery life on a single charge .
the apple battery achieve its better performance by use custom-designed lithium-polymer cell that be 40 % larger than the previous generation .
however , to fit the battery in the system , apple have make it nonremovable , which may turn off some potential buyer .
because of the extend lifespan of the battery , apple say the macbook be more environmentally friendly than the previous generation , since the power supply do not have to be replace so often .
the notebook be less than a inch thick , weigh 6.6 pound , and feature a light-emitting diode screen with a $ 50 anti-glare option .
in addition , the system come with a nvidia geforce 9400m integrate graphic processor and a discrete nvidia 9600m gt processor .
switch to the latter give better graphic performance at the expense of about a hour of battery life .

a faster 1066 mhz front-side bus and newer generation of intel core 2 duo processor with 6mb shared l2 cache , clock at 2.66 ghz , bring a evolutionary speed increase over the previous model .

'' apple 's advanced chemistry and innovative technology deliver up to eight hour of use on a full charge cycle and up to 1,000 recharge . '' .
the company claim that a '' properly maintain '' battery in this notebook will retain 80 % or more of its original capacity during a lifespan of up to 1,000 recharge cycle .
connectivity option include wireless 802.11 network courtesy of the built-in airport extreme card , a bluetooth 2.1 + edr module and gigabit ethernet .
the machine also have one firewire 800 port for connect video camera and other professional audio and video equipment , three usb 2.0 port , audio line in and out port , each support both digital and analog , and expresscard/34 expansion card slot .
storage feature include 320gb sata hdd run at 5400 rpm , with apple 's sudden motion sensor that prevent head to scratch platter surface if the machine be suddenly drop , and a slot-load 8x superdrive with double-layer support .

apple unveil new flagship macbook pro .
june 11 , 2012 .
apple have unveil its new flagship next generation macbook pro .
apple have unveil its new flagship laptop : the next generation macbook pro .
this new macbook pro boast several upgrade of note , include a slimmer profile : at 0 . 71 inch thick , it be the same thickness as a macbook air .
apple ceo tim cook claim that it thinner than my finger and will weigh just 4 . 5 pound .
the aesthetics of the next generation macbook pro will remain the same : it will still have the same aluminum unibody case and backlit keyboard .
the main difference of note be the internal component and the display .
either a i5 or i7 quad core intel processor power the next generation macbook pro .
couple with turbo boost , the i7 will be able to reach speed of up to 3 . 7 ghz .
this flagship model with run off 16gb of ram , and will also have up to 768 gb of flash storage .
for a graphic processor , the next generation macbook pro will have a 1gb geforce gt 650m graphic card .
all this hardware will be necessary to help support the shiny new display spec .
tim cook announce that apple new laptop will have retina display , mean that you not be able to distinguish individual pixel from a typical view distance .
in hard number , that mean the screen with have a 2880x1800 resolution with 220 pixel per inch .
the next generation macbook pro will also carry some standard port , and a number upgrade port .
it will have two usb port which will support both 3 . 0 and 2 . 0 .
it will also have two thunderbolt , a hdmi , a sd card reader , and a headphone jack .
the new pro do not include a ethernet jack or firewire 800 port , but apple have introduce two adapter that offer thunderbolt to gigabit ethernet and thunderbolt to firewire 800 connection .
so , the standard model will have a 15 . 4 retina display , 2 . 3 ghz i7 , 8gb of ram , 256 gb of flash storage , and a geforce gt 650m .
the final price tag for the next generation macbook pro ?
2199 .
the higher end model cost 2799 .
apple be also upgrade the current macbook pro and air model .
both laptop will receive new ivy bridge cpus , but the price will not increase .
the 11 - inch air will cost from 999 up to 1099 .
the 13 macbook air will get a 1 . 8 ghz i5 dual core processor and intel hd graphic 4000 , a nd the price remain at 1099 to 1499 .
the macbook pro be get more upgrade .
the 13 model will have the option for a 2 . 9 ghz i7 , 750 gb hdd , and up to 8 gb of ram , price at 1799 .
lower - specc model will cost from 1199 .
also of note , be that the the new macbook pro will support two usb 3 . 0 port .
the 15 model with have either 2 . 3 or 2 . 6 ghz i7 quad core .
they will also have upgrade gpus , a choice between either 516mb or 1gb geforce gt 650m .
these large model will be price between 1799 and 2199 , but for that price might as well hold out for the next generation macbook pro with the retina display .
all of these new model be available immediately .

bombing at yida refugee camp , south sudan .

samaritan purse refugee camp bomb , allegedly by sudanese government .
november 14 , 2011 : 35 pm .
the government of sudan bomb the samaritan purse refugee camp in yida , south sudan , on thursday , nov . 10 , allege the nondenominational evangelical christian organization .
the camp , located in the oil - rich northern region of yida , consist of over 24 , 000 refugee who have flee the heavy fighting of sudan south kordofan region .
the camp at yida be a area of thick bush just about ten mile south of the generally recognize border between south sudan and sudan .
the bombing be a result of the heighten tension between sudan and south sudan .
south sudan gain its independence from sudan 6 month ago , end one of africa longest civil war .
sudan accuse south sudan of arm sudanese rebel in the border state of southern kordofan and the blue nile , accord to the new york time .
samaritan purse provide aid , both spiritually and physically , to those in need .
the organization use dc - 3 plane to deliver food to the refugee of yida .
the plane deliver six to seven load a day , three day a week .
the organization have drop 420 ton of food staple to the refugee , and be in connection with the u . n . 's world food program .
accord to a samaritan purse press release , sudan armed force plane drop four bomb at 3 : 20 p . m . in the region thursday .
ken isaac , vice president of program and government relation at samaritan purse , tell the christian post that the bombing as a terrifying event for all of the staff and the people in we community . '' .
one bomb hit a 200 - student schoolhouse but do not explode , another bomb hit the community marketplace and two other hit the outskirts of the camp .
the bomb do not do any damage and , accord to isaac , one bomb land just 5 foot away from a boy , but do not explode .
'' -lsb- the -rsb- minetech international -lrb- mti -rrb- explosive ordinance disposal -lrb- eod -rrb- team remove the bomb from the yida village school and move it to a isolate location for disposal at a later date , '' accord to the unite nation mine action coordination center of south sudan .
i urge the united state and the international community to enforce a no - fly zone in the area to protect not only the innocent civilian there but also those who be try to help they , '' samaritan purse president franklin graham say in a press release .
my prayer be that the world will not just sit by and watch and hope for the best like they do during rwanda , where close to a million people be massacre .
we need to make it clear to the government of sudan that attack on innocent people will not be tolerate , '' the evangelist say .
the white house have also condemn the bombing .
in a press statement release nov . 10 , the white house urge the government to stop the bombing immediately .
we urge the government of south sudan to exercise restraint in respond to this provocation to prevent further escalation of hostility , '' read the press release .
the refugee camp have just receive food ration when the bombing take place .
graham say these bombing be a tactic reminiscent of sudan civil war , use to injure and kill as many as possible .
the food be deliver , the attacker wait for people to gather to collect the food , and then they bomb the mass .
accord to the new york time , a satellite - imaging program reveal a build - up of sudanese troops near the south sudan border in the blue nile region .
image also reportedly reveal upgrade air basis recently capture by government force .
sudan government deny a connection to the bombing .
sudanese government spokesperson rabie a . atti defend the government sunday , say , we be only secure we border . '' .
susan rice , u . s . ambassador for the unite nation , say the sudan government blatantly lie about the bombing , add that such a lie prove very disturbing to the united state and many member of the u . n . security council .
as isaac of samaritan purse contend , sudan government deny any bombing in south sudan . '' .
what do they consider to be south sudan ? '' isaacs question , note that there be element of a border dispute , with yida be only 10 mile from the border .
describe yida as a very insecure area , isaacs express worry for the future of yida refugee .
the conflict and the insecurity be go to grow .
it be go to get worse before it get better , '' he say .
there be a need to relocate the people .
the area that have be offer for relocation be not agreeable , '' he add .
accord to isaac , food supplies be rapidly dwindle .
the refugee receive a three - day ration on oct . 29 , a one - day ration on nov . 7th and a one - day ration on nov . 11 .

in a unprecedented move that suggest that there might be life in the old dog yet , amd have acquire seamicro , a company that build high - density , low - power server use intel cpus .
the deal cost amd 334 million -lrb- 281m in cash -rrb- , a fairly sizable chunk of change when you consider that its yearly profit be usually around the 400 million mark .
if you haven '' t hear of seamicro before , they '' be essentially a silicon valley startup build around a technology call freedom fabric , a asic -lrb- application - specific integrate circuit -rrb- that allow a computer to be scale down to a motherboard the size of a deck of play card .
these tiny computer -lrb- each one contain a atom or xeon cpu , some dram , and the freedom fabric asic -rrb- be then stack together to form very - high - density server -lrb- picture above -rrb- .
these server brick be just 10u in size , contain up to 768 cpus , and include four gigabit ethernet switch and a load balancer .
to achieve the same kind of processing power with conventional rackmount server you would need two full rack -lrb- 84u ! -rrb- of dual - socket quad - core server and network gear .
the seamicro server brick use a quarter of the power , too , because the custom cpu - dram - asic contain absolutely no hardware cruft that leech power .
in short , with energy price increase , datum center real estate as costly as ever , and the web show no sign of slow down , seamicro server be really rather desirable .
more than miniaturization , though , freedom fabric be also compatible with multiple instruction set and allow for complete hardware virtualization ; both very desirable property in this age of cloud computing .
but why do amd buy seamicro ?
as it stand , seamicro have a tight partnership with intel , and every seamicro server use intel chip .
accord to amd , seamicro will sell intel - base server '' for the foreseeable future , '' but a opteron - base solution should arrive by the end of the year .
in all likelihood , amd probably see seamicro as a excellent way of bolster its presence in the incredibly lucrative -lrb- and rapidly expand -rrb- server market .
with seamicro , amd can deal directly with company look for server , cut out the -lrb- very profitable -rrb- hp , dell , or ibm middle man .
the server space be one area that amd still seem to be able compete with intel and with freedom fabric amd might once again become a compelling choice .

but the problem with families-especially those form by multibillion-dollar corporate mergers-is that they often end up dysfunctional .
promise cost savings and sale increase do not always pan out , and integration of disparate culture and operation be frequently fraught with value-destroying rift .
