amd enter server business with bold acquisition .
02 . 29 . 12 4 : 15 pm .
chip designer and chief intel rival amd have sign a agreement to acquire seamicro , a silicon valley startup that seek to save power and space by build server from hundred of low - power processor .
with the purchase , amd will not only turn itself into a server maker , it will turn itself into a server maker that use chip from intel .
today , seamicro '' s server be build with processor from amd '' s rival , include intel '' s atom mobile processor as well as intel xeon chip .
amd say it will continue to sell and support seamicro server equip with intel chip '' for the foreseeable future . '' .
but it also hope to license seamicro '' s server '' fabric '' technology to other server seller , include big name dell and hp , and it plan to introduce amd opteron chip into seamicro machine sometime in the second half of the year .
seamicro '' s fabric be a way of efficiently connect various piece of server hardware , and the company say it can be use with virtually any processor .
less than a month ago , intel and seamicro hold a joint press event where they predict a bright future together , so it would appear that the amd acquisition come about rather quickly .
but amd '' be lisa su -- the company '' s senior vice president and general manager for its global business unit -- say the chip designer have be eye technology along the line of seamicro '' s for some time .
'' we '' ve be look at the key technology innovation that be go to really disrupt the server market .
we '' ve be look at fabric technology -- externally with a number of company as well as internally , look to develop ourselves -- and we feel that seamicro be really the best option .
it be prove , and it be in system , '' su say on wednesday morning during a briefing with reporter .
'' the complement of we processing capability and seamicro '' s fabric technology give we what we think be a very , very strong -lsb- intellectual property -rsb- portfolio . '' .
amd will pay 334 million for seamicro , include 281 million in cash .
the deal be expect to close in '' a number of week . '' .
base in sunnyvale , california , seamicro be at the forefront of a movement to build server from ultra - low - power processor -- aka '' wimpy core . '' .
the idea be to reduce power by splitting application into small piece that can be spread across a larger number of chip , not unlike the one run you cell phone .
texa startup calxeda offer '' wimpy core '' server equip with chip use the arm instruction set -- a alternative to the x86 instruction set use by intel and amd -- while hp be explore the idea with a research effort it call project moonshot .
but last month , during that press event co - host by intel , seamicro announce that it would also offer server equip with intel xeon chip , which be specifically design for server .
xeon consume more power , but they also offer more speed .
seamicro say that certain software workload be suit to the wimpy core , while other be suit to '' brawny core , '' and this same message be deliver by the likes of dave andersen , the carnegie melon professor who coin the wimpy core name .
whatever processor it use , seamicro say , it can save power and space when you compare its machine to traditional server .
the company have build specialize asic chip load with software that allow the company to build ultra - small motherboard that include little more than processor , memory , and the asic itself -- and then connect hundred of these board .
accord to the company , this technology be '' chip agnostic , '' mean it can relatively easily be use with new chip architecture .
amd and seamicro say that they will '' explore '' the use of seamicro '' s fabric with all sort of processor , both wimpy and brawny .
this may include arm chip .
in recent week , amd have hint that it will eventually license arm technology .
ask if the company will continue to offer ultra - low - power chip along the line of the intel atom , seamicro ceo and co - founder andrew feldman say '' absolutely . '' .
but he decline to point to specific processor architecture .
'' this -lsb- seamicro fabric -rsb- technology can work with larger core and small core .
it can work with x86 and non - x86 .
it can also move ethernet traffic and storage traffic , '' feldman say .
amd chief technology officer mark papermaster then pipe up to point out that amd be intent on use whatever chip technology be need to get a particular job do .
'' if you look at we roadmap , we have a very agile -lsb- system - on - a - chip -rsb- , '' he say .
'' it allow we to be more pushy in bring in we ip . '' .
seamicro currently employ 80 people , and about half of they be engineer .
one of those engineer be founder and chief technology officer gary lauterbach , who be previously a amd fellow and one of five architect who build the core of amd '' s opteron processor .
lauterbach be also a lead chip designer at sun microsystem , and the idea for seamicro first come to he when he and another sun executive get a look at the low - power server that power google '' be search engine in the early part of the last decade .
andrew feldman will become the general manager of amd '' s new '' datum center solution '' business .
accord to su , this business unit will continue to support the current '' roadmap '' for seamicro '' s server .
this mean that the company will sell and service seamicro '' s intel atom and intel xeon system -- though su indicate that the company will eventually drop intel '' s chip .
she say that amd opteron chip will be add to seamicro system '' towards the end of this year . '' .
intel '' s jason waxman -- who head the company '' s general manager of intel '' be high density computing group -- tell wire that amd '' s acquisition of seamicro '' doesn '' t change a whole lot '' for intel .
he say that amd will decide whether to keep sell seamicro server with intel chip , and that intel will continue to reduce the power consumption of both its xeon and atom chip for use inside server .
'' be able to launch the seamicro product with intel xeon silicon be a good testimonial for we .
they think we be the best partner at the time , '' waxman say .
'' they choose we silicon for a reason . '' .
whatever the fate of intel chip in seamicro server , amd say the acquisition be about more than just sell machine .
the idea be also to '' broaden '' amd '' s relationship with server seller such as dell and hp .
presumably , this mean that amd will license seamicro '' s fabric technology to third - party .
'' we have new technology that we can add to we exist opteron roadmap to form something that can really differentiate we in the marketplace , '' su say .
andrew feldman add that seamicro have already have discussion along these line with the likes of dell and hp .
currently , dell resell seamicro server .
that say , the acquisition mean that -- on some level -- amd will be compete with its own customer .
it will be both chip designer and server maker .
but su downplay this notion .
'' we be not compete with we customer .
we have to balance the fact that will continue to support -lsb- seamicro -rsb- product .
but the goal be to proliferate the technology with oem , '' su say , refer to original equipment manufacturer such as dell and hp .
'' what we see be a chance to take we technology to multiple market , with multiple partner , in multiple geography -- in way we couldn '' t do on we own , '' say seamicro ceo and new amd general manager andrew feldman .
'' the opportunity to collaborate with the oem be larger than the opportunity to compete with they . '' .

amd buy sea micro for 334m to get into energy - efficient '' microserver '' .
february 29 , 2012 2 : 27 pm .
there '' be a sea change happen in a segment of the server market dub microserver .
and sea micro have be at the center of it , disrupt the market with energy efficient server that use lightweight processor from intel .
advanced micro device be acquire sea micro today for 334 million , include 281 million in cash .
sea micro have be disruptive because it can pack a lot of compute power in a server rack that be about a sixth of the usual size .
its server use a quarter of the usual electricity and cost a lot less .
the server use intel '' s atom microprocessor , which be target at energy efficient device such as tablet computer .
but amd '' be move could shake thing up for intel , which presumably will lose some of its business .
the advantage of sunnyvale , calif . - base seamicro '' s small and power - efficient computer be that enterprise can now shove a lot more computing power into a give amount of space and use a lot less electrical power , thereby cut electricity bill dramatically .
that matter because electricity cost be the biggest part of the budget for operate datum center .
andrew feldman , chief executive of sea micro have say in past interview that seamicro have become the fastest - grow system company in silicon valley history .
seamicro '' s customer include france telecom , skype , roger wireless , mozilla , eharmony , and china netcom bb .
hundred of million of internet user traverse seamicro '' s hardware daily .
as we '' ve describe in earlier story , intel have be improve its server microprocessor by make they more power efficient .
but the microprocessor only account for a third of the power consumption in a server .
seamicro '' s innovation lie in how it attack the remain two - third of the power consumption problem .
it do so by combine a lot of the extraneous chip into a single , more - efficient custom chip , feldman say .
in its earliest system , seamicro put 384 intel atom dual - core processor -lrb- for a total of 64 - bit 768 core -rrb- in a 10 - rack system , which be just 17 . 5 inch high .
the newer sm10000 - 64hd be a 20 percent improvement over seamicro '' s previous server line and a 150 percent improvement on its compute density record , or the amount of compute power in a give space .
that single machine could replace rival system with a bunch of equipment : 60 traditional server , four rack switch , four terminal server , and a load balancing server .
it use a quarter of the power and a sixth of the space .
seamicro can put a entire server on a motherboard that be 5 inch by 11 inch .
since the hardware be intel - base , customer don '' t have to change they software at all .
seamicro be found in 2007 and be back with 60 million in funding by khosla venture , draper fisher jurvetson , crosslink capital , and a number of strategic investor .
it also win grant from the u . s . departement of energy -lrb- 9 . 3 million -rrb- and the state of california -lrb- 250 , 000 -rrb- .
seamicro have 80 employee .
most recently , it raise 20 million .
seamicro also attack the power consumption problem with a very clever trick know as virtualization .
today , virtualization be frequently use with server .
it be a layer of software that rest between a application and the server that it run on .
if a application need only two server , the virtualization software find two available server to run the application .
if the application get busy and need 10 server , the virtualization software find 10 available server to do the job .
the application be no longer tie to specific server ; the virtualization software free up the overall system and get more use out of the available server .
seamicro do the same thing , but it apply the concept of virtualization to the inside of a server .
feldman design custom chip that could take the task that be handle by everything beyond the intel microprocessor and its chip set .
the custom chip virtualize all of those other component so that it find the resource when it '' s need .
it essentially trick the microprocessor into think that the rest of the system be there when it need it .
seamicro virtualize a lot of function that take up a lot of space inside each server in a rack .
it also do the same with function such as storage , networking , server management , and load balancing .
full tell , seamicro eliminate 90 percent of the component from a system board .
seamicro call this cpu / io virtualization .
with it , seamicro shrink the size of the system board from a pizza box to the size of a credit card .
by boil down the rest of the system into a couple of chip , seamicro can get rid of a lot of the component in a system , thereby get rid of space , cost , and power consumption .
the buy should also expand amd 's manufacturing capability , as well as integrate microprocessor and graphic engine in a single chip .
the acquisition be set to be wrap up by year 's end .
advanced micro device -lrb- nyse : amd -rrb- announce the largest acquisition in its history monday , pay about $ 5.4 billion to acquire graphic chip specialist ati technology .
the acquisition will let amd expand its position in the commercial desktop and mobile computing market , two area where the company have not have much success .
in addition to accelerate the company 's x86 processor market share battle with intel -lrb- nsdq : intc -rrb- , the acquisition will expand amd 's access to manufacture capacity and will lead to product that will integrate both microprocessor and graphic engine in a single chip in future release .
the startup manage large-scale web infrastructure to prevent downtime related to configuration change march madness 2008 be carry in full on the internet , on demand thanks to the technology innovation of cb sport and cb interactive gm 's tech leader talk about consolidate , re-engineering , upgrade the company 's application infrastructure .

'' we be confident the company will integrate well together .
we believe that as technology advance , integration be not only inevitable , but also advantageous . '' .
begin next year , the company will market '' customer-centric platform '' use amd and ati technology that will include all exist product offering .
begin in 2008 , amd plan to introduce platform that integrate general purpose processor and graphic engine to meet specific media , datum , and graphic requirement , say dave orton , president and chief executive of ati .
bob rivet , cfo of amd , say the acquisition be expect to be complete by year 's end .
the purchase be a combination of $ 4.2 billion in cash and 57 million share of amd stock .
amd 's current area of greatest strength be provide processor that address the server and consumer desktop market , rivet say .
bring ati 's graphic technology in-house will allow amd to better address the commercial desktop and laptop market , he say , two area where amd currently have a smaller presence .
while overall sale of x86 processor currently total about $ 30 billion annually , amd be primarily address only a segment that total about $ 13 billion , rivet say .
by expand more into commercial desktop and laptop market , amd will be able to grow its overall x86 market share .
rivet say that each percentage of market share gain equate to about $ 300 million in revenue .
ruiz say the acquisition '' open up a broad array of option for expand we capacity infrastructure '' by provide amd with a expand relationship with some of the largest semiconductor foundry in the world .
currently amd utilize internal manufacturing capacity , as well as capacity from chartered semiconductor manufacturing .
ati , however , have manufacture relationship with two of the other largest foundry in the world , taiwan semiconductor manufacturing and unite microelectronics .
the acquisition of ati by amd will now provide computer maker and customer with another choice for integrate microprocessor and graphic processor platform , say bruce shaw , director of worldwide commercial marketing for amd .
currently only intel offer a integrated platform .
although amd will be provide integrate platform , it will continue to support the use of third-party graphic product , such as those from nvidia , in combination with its processor , shaw say .
amd have no plan to reduce the ati product line or back away from market it address , such as cell phone , where amd have little or no presence , he say .
ati be expect to continue to operate out of its headquarters in markham , ontario , and layoff be expect to be minimal .

amd acquire seamicro -- big bet on architectural shift for server .
summary : rich fichera look at the risk and potential reward of amd recent acquisition of innovative server startup seamicro .
march 1 , 2012 - - 07 : 58 gmt -lrb- 23 : 58 pst -rrb- .
at its recent financial analyst day , amd indicate that intend to differentiate itself by create product that be advantage in niche market , with specific mention , among other segment , of server , and to generally shake up the trench warfare that have have it on the lose side of its lifelong battle with intel -lrb- my interpretation , not amd management '' s word -rrb- .
today , at least for the server side of the business they make a move that can potentially offer they visibility and differentiation by acquire innovative server startup seamicro .
seamicro have attract we attention since its appearance -lrb- blog post 1 , blog post 2 -rrb- , with its innovative architecture that dramatically reduce power and improve density by share component like i / o adapter , disk and even bio over a proprietary fabric .
the irony here be that seamicro come to market with a tight alignment with intel , who at one pint even introduce a special dual - core packaging of they atom cpu to allow seamicro improve its density and power efficiency .
most recently seamicro and intel announce a new model which feature xeon cpus to address the more mainstream segment that be not a for seamicro '' s original atom - base offering .
so what do amd hope to gain from this acquisition ?
the strategic goal be a differentiate server architecture into which they can insert amd silicon and ip .
the seamicro architecture share many of the characteristic of the calxeda / hp redstone architecture , and can potentially allow amd to produce reference architecture for its system partner to leverage that give they significant density advantage over any conventional x86 server offering .
since this architecture be initially target at dense computing environment such as those find in web 2 . 0 , cloud service provider and similar workload , as well as potentially at conventional hpc , the prospects for amd be interesting .
long - term success will hinge on several interlock factor .
1 . how much will amd focus this offering on the ultra - dense space that seamicro start address versus try to also take a bite out of the enterprise space ?
2 . how aggressively will they scale it ?
the seamicro fabric do not extend beyond the single enclosure boundary , but that appear to be a implementation decision , not a fundamental architectural issue .
my personal belief be that fabric - base server be the wave of the future , with seamicro calxeda / hp serve as very significant guideline for future development .
scale the fabric first for management and then for actual datum traffic for shared i / o and eventually for coherent memory operation if need be a natural progression .
3 . what other ip will amd add ?
amd have a interesting portfolio of gpu technology as well as cpu , and the incorporation of gpu technology could provide further differentiation in niche market .
amd have a choice of way to monetize this ip , from sell system base on its own processor -lrb- possibly as early as late this year -rrb- to provide reference design and / or license the architecture or sell component like the fabric asic .
4 . will they also support arm processor ?
if amd become the source of licensed ip for vendor want to chase hp in ultra - dense server , they can also make money by license they technology and selling component for non - x86 architecture .
5 . what will intel do ?
at least one of intel '' s partner , hp , already have a fabric - base dense server design that can support x86 .
will intel develop a similar reference architecture in the hope that they major system partner will adopt it ?
all in all , many way this could play out , but a bold move and one that may serve to trigger a rapid change in the type of server available to user over the next 24 month .

here we take a brief look at the price that amd pay for seamicro , and what this imply about its growth expectation .
amd shell out 334 million for the acquisition of seamicro .

however , base on certain assumption , it be possible to understand the range of amd '' be growth expectation from seamicro .
for the purpose of calculation , we assume that seamicro operate at ebitda margin of close to 25 and apply similar corporate expense -lrb- as % of revenue -rrb- include tax , capital expenditure and other that we apply for amd .
if we assume seamicro '' s revenue for 2012 will be somewhere around 50 million , it imply that amd expect seamicro '' s revenue to grow at a average annual rate of 43 to 44 over the course of we forecast period , which extend till 2018 .
these revenue include both seamicro '' be revenue as well as incremental benefit in server - related revenue from the acquisition .
on the other hand , if we assume seamicro '' s revenue for 2012 to be of the order of 150 million , it imply that amd '' be growth expectation for seamicro and related incremental server revenue stand at somewhere around 16 to 17 .
accord to amd '' be own calculation , it have pay a handsome price for the acquisition .
we price estimate for amd stand at 9 . 21 , imply a premium of little under 15 to the market price .

philadelphia 76er president and general manager ed stefanskus announce that the team have relieve maurice cheek of he head coaching responsibility .
cheek will be replace on a interim basis by sixer senior vice president and assistant general manager tony dileo , who will remain in the position through the end of the 2008-09 season .
'' decision of this nature be never easy , and this be particularly difficult due to the great amount of respect i have for maurice cheek , '' stefanskus say .
'' however , at this time i feel that it be in the best interest of this team to make a change while there be still time to accomplish the goal we set forth for ourselves at the start of the season .
'' tony dileo have a wealth of basketball knowledge and coaching experience - both in the nba and on the international level - and be familiar not only with we current group of player but the style of play we be strive to attain on a consistent basis . '' .
dileo be in he 19th season with the sixer organization and be in he fifth as the team 's senior vice president and assistant general manager .
during he tenure with the sixer , dileo have be involve in every aspect of the team 's basketball operation .
in he role as senior vice president and assistant general manager , dileo be responsible for assist stefanskus with player procurement via he evaluation of amateur and professional talent while supervise the team 's draft effort and oversee the college and professional scout system .
prior to that , dileo spend four season as the sixer director of player personnel -lrb- 1999-2003 -rrb- and have serve as a assistant coach under larry brown , jim lynam , fred carter , john luca and doug moe .
dileo have extensive experience in international basketball as both a player and a coach .
he coach the former west german man 's and woman 's team from 1979-90 , win nine national title in that country 's top division , earn coach of the year honor in 1987 .
additionally , he be select as the west german federation national coach from 1981-85 and during that time , write and publish the european basketball handbook , a guide design to acclimate american player overseas .
a star at cinnaminson -lrb- n.j. -rrb- high school , dileo go on to play at tennessee tech and lasalle university , where as a junior he be name first-team academic all-american and go on to graduate maximum cum laude from the lasalle school of business .

this be not a task to be take lightly , and i will put every effort into realize a beautiful film to stand alongside a beautiful book . '' .

about the twilight film series .
the twilight film series star robert pattinson and kristen stewart and tell the story of 17-year-old bella swan who move to the small town of fork , washington to live with she father , and become draw to edward cullen , a pale , mysterious classmate who seem determine to push she away .
but neither can deny the attraction that pull they together ... even when edward confide that he and he family be vampire .
the action-packed , modern day vampire love story and blockbuster success the first film in the series entitle twilight be release in theatre on november 21st gross $ 69.6 million domestically during its first weekend .
to date the film have gross over $ 142 million domestically .
about summit entertainment llc .
summit entertainment be a worldwide theatrical motion picture development , financing , production and distribution studio .
the studio handle all aspect of marketing and distribution for both its own internally developed motion picture as well as acquire picture .
summit entertainment , llc also represent international sale for both its own slate and third party product .
summit entertainment , llc plan to release 10 to 12 film annually .

the 32-year-old klitschko -lrb- 52-3 , 46 ko -rrb- win he 10th consecutive bout by flooring rahman -lrb- 45-7-2 -rrb- once before referee tony week stop the fight 44 seconds into the seventh round .

scientific consultation under endanger species act restore .
washington , dc , april 28 , 2009 .
the obama administration today revoke a eleventh - hour bush - era rule that undermine protection for plant and animal list as threaten or endanger under the endanger species act .
pass in january 2009 , the bush - era rule lift the requirement that federal agency consult wildlife expert with the u . s . fish and wildlife service or the national oceanic and atmospheric administration before take action that could harm list species .
the bush move allow federal agency to decide for themselves if they own project , such as road , dam and mine , would hurt species .
secretary of commerce gary locke and secretary of the interior ken salazar , who head the two agency that administer the endanger species act , say they decision to again require consultation before action be base on sound science .
by roll back this 11th hour regulation , we be ensure that threaten and endanger species continue to receive the full protection of the law , '' salazar say .
because science must serve as the foundation for decision we make , federal agency propose to take action that might affect threaten and endanger species will once again have to consult with biologist at the two department , '' he say .
for decade , the endanger species act have protect threaten species and they habitat , '' say locke .
we decision affirm the administration commitment to use sound science to promote conservation and protect the environment . '' .
in march , president barack obama direct the secretary to review the previous administration section 7 regulation of the endanger species act , which govern interagency consultation .
congress , in the 2009 omnibus appropriation act , specifically authorize the secretary to revoke the regulation .
locke and salazar say the two department will conduct a joint review of the 1986 consultation regulation that be now once again in effect to determine if any improvement should be propose .
the endanger species act be sign into law in 1973 to protect imperil species from extinction , as well as conserve the ecosystem and habitat necessary for they survival .
today there be 1 , 009 species in the united state list as endanger under the act - 409 animal and 600 plant .
a additional 162 animal and 146 plant be list as threaten .
environmentalist and scientist who have lobby against make consultation discretionary be please with the decision .

once again , we nation will follow the letter of the law and the advice of its own best expert before jeopardize the future of threaten and endanger species . '' .
the decision come as president obama prepare to mark he first 100 day in office on wednesday .
loyless say , the president have cap he first hundred day with a serious step toward restore we commitment to this nation great natural heritage . '' .
last friday , 1 , 300 biologist and three scientific society represent some 20 , 000 scientist - the ornithological council , society for conservation biology and the wildlife society - send separate letter to the interior and commerce department urge they to overturn the last - minute bush rule change .
many federal agency do not have the scientific expertise to determine the consequence of federal project on endanger species and may have vest interest in the implementation of a project , '' say stuart pimm , dori duke professor of conservation ecology at duke university , who help organize the scientist letter .
pimm say the bush rule exclude from the process expert scientist who for decade have provide impartial review and critical analysis of proposed project .

put boundary on the science that inform the endanger species act fundamentally undermine the ability of science and scientist to protect we nation biodiversity . '' .

with just over a month remain in office , the bush administration loosen federal protection of plant and animal species threaten with extinction .
on thursday , the interior department announce a change to section 7 of the endanger species act , which require federal agency to consult with scientist at the fish and wildlife service or the national marine fishery service to determine whether a project be likely to affect any list species .
under the new rule , federal agency such as the federal highway administration can in many case simply check with they own personnel to determine if they activity will harm any of the 1,247 animal and 747 plant species list as endanger or threaten .
'' the rule strengthen the regulation so the government can focus on protect endanger species as it strive to rebuild the american economy , '' say secretary of the interior dirk kempthorne .
it start with the polar bear .
the rule change have its origin in a may announcement by the interior department that list the polar bear as threaten because global warming be melt its habitat .
it be the first animal to be list because of climate change .
in that announcement , interior secretary dirk kempthorne say that even though global climate change be the reason that the bear be on the endanger species list in the first place , that list be '' not the means , nor the method , nor the vehicle by which you can deal with global climate change . '' .
the interior department 's press release cite a may editorial from the washington post that endorse this view .
that mr. kempthorne have to contort he agency to ensure that it do not get drag into set we climate policy be simply more proof of the need for such a policy , support by the white house and ratify by congress , that aim at sharply reduce greenhouse-gas emission .
though the polar bear deserve protection , the endanger species act be not the means and the fish and wildlife service be not the agency to arrest global warming .
the release quote the second sentence of that paragraph .
so under the new rule , federal agency that be undertake a project need not check with fish and wildlife or national marine fishery under these circumstance .
where the action have no effect on a list species or critical habitat , or .
where the action be wholly beneficial , or .
where the effect of the action can not be measure or detect in a manner that permit meaningful evaluation use the best available science , or .
where the effect of the action be the result of global process and can not be reliably predict or measure on the scale of species current range , or would result in a insignificant impact to a list species , or be such that the potential risk of harm to a species be remote .
reaction .

reversible ?
obama say that he intend to reverse the rule change , along with other '' midnight rule '' make in the wane day of the bush presidency .
but that may be easier say than do .
propublica , a nonprofit investigative news organization , note that while last-minute rule that have not yet take effect can be quickly reverse by obama 's appointee or by executive order , rule that be in force when he take office can not .
rescind a rule would require the new administration to restart the rulemaking process , which can take year and prompt legal challenge .
another strategy that have be talk about lately - get congress to disapprove the rule through the congressional review act - carry political risk and have be use only once before .

the interior department yesterday finalize rule change the way it administer the endanger species act , enable other government agency to decide on they own whether a project would harm a imperil species without a independent scientific review .
interior secretary dirk kempthorne call the move '' a clarification '' he consider essential in order to narrow the law 's reach .
'' the rule strengthen the regulation so the government can focus on protect endanger species as it strive to rebuild the american economy , '' kempthorne say , add that agency can bypass a review by either the fish and wildlife service or the national oceanic and atmospheric administration only '' in specific and limited instance where a action be not anticipate to harass , harm or kill a protected species . '' .
dale hall , who direct the fish and wildlife service , say the change do not mean that agency could build dam , road or other project without take into account the consequence .
'' the agency still have the full responsibility to make that decision and to defend that decision , '' hall say , note that the loss of a imperil species , know as '' take , '' carry legal penalty .
'' they be still liable for take , if take occur . '' .
hall say he be initially concern about '' the compress time frame '' in which the agency push through the rule change , which be unveil in august , but he add that he do not '' see any harm '' in kempthorne 's final decision .
interior go ahead with the rule change one day after the environmental protection agency drop two other controversial rule change , say they have come along too late in president bush 's term white house spokesman tony fratto say the reason be that the administration have '' publicly and clearly state we intention '' to enact the endanger species measure well before a self-imposed deadline on eleventh-hour rule change .

separately yesterday , interior issue a finding limit the protection that could be invoke to protect polar bear , which be list as a threaten species this year , on the grounds that the bear be already protect under the marine mammal protection act .
the finding mean that the bear ' protected status could not be use to block activity such as oil and gas development outside they alaska habitat .

obama overturn bush endanger species rule .
president obama on tuesday overturn a last - minute bush administration regulation that many environmentalist claim weaken the endanger species act .
the regulation , issue a few week before george w . bush left office , make it easier for federal agency to skip consultation with government scientist before launch project that could affect endanger wildlife .
by overturn the regulation , obama say during a enthusiastic reception at the interior department , he have restore the scientific process to its rightful place at the heart of the endanger species act , a process undermine by past administration . '' .
under the bush administration rule , there be no need for a federal agency to consult with the u . s . fish and wildlife service or the national marine fishery service if that agency determine that no harm would come to a endanger species as a result of its project .
but the determination of what no harm mean rest with agency bureaucrat instead of scientist .
obama issue a memorandum that effectively suspend the regulation while order a review to determine whether it promote the purpose of the -lsb- endanger species act -rsb- . '' .
the work of scientist and expert in my administration , include right here in the interior department , will be respect , '' obama say .

interior secretary dirk kempthorne announce major change thursday to the endanger species act , cause environmental group to charge that the '' midnight rule '' set to go into effect before president-elect barack obama take office be intend to eviscerate the nation 's premier wildlife-protection law .
the regulation eliminate a requirement that federal agency seek review by government scientist before approve log , mining and construction project to make sure the activity do not endanger rare animal and plant .
in addition , the regulation say the law could not be use to protect polar bear , walrus , mountain frog and other species vulnerable to the effect of global warming .
'' the bush administration be use this to go after we most imperil wildlife and kick they when they be down , '' say janette brimmer , a attorney with earthjustice , a environmental group .
'' the act be we nation 's most important law for protect wildlife like wolf , grizzly , salmon and lynx . '' .
reid cherlin , a spokesman for the obama-biden transition team , say , '' president-elect obama will review all 11th-hour regulation and will address they once he take office . '' .
obama have say he do not favor change the endanger species act .
kempthorne , at a news conference in washington , say that he know change to the act would evoke controversy but that he be certain the new rule would clear up confusion over the law that have exist for year .
'' nothing in the regulation relieve a federal agency of its responsibility to ensure that species be not harm , '' he say .
law cover 1,400 species .
the law protect 1,400 species .
in the last eight year , there have be a slowdown in add new plant and animal , build a backlog of hundred of species wait for scientific review and approval , include california 's furry pacific fisher and sierra nevada yellow-legged frog .
the interior department propose the new regulation in may and since have receive nearly 300,000 comment , the vast majority oppose the change .
hour after thursday 's announcement , three environmental group , greenpeace , defender of wildlife and center for biological diversity , file a lawsuit in u.s. district court in san francisco seek to halt regulation that they say be inconsistent with the act .
the regulation do not require federal agency to seek consultation with u.s. fish and wildlife service and national marine fishery service before approve project , the lawsuit say .
in congress , rep. edward markey , d-mass , call a hearing to review the regulation and say member would work to restore the act rep. nick rahall , d-w , say member may try to eliminate the regulation by use a special congressional act that allow the review of newly adopt administrative rule .
part of the new regulation prohibit regulator from take into account the effect of greenhouse gas on habitat and on species .
kempthorne say he legal adviser conclude that consider global warm a threat to the survival of the polar bear would require tracking emission to a particular factory and determine how that would melt arctic ice and harm the bear .
'' that be completely wrong , and they be just make that up , '' say attorney kassie siegel of the center for biological diversity , which be sue the federal government in a attempt to protect polar bear .
federal agency be suppose to look at source of greenhouse gas from project they approve , then analyze way to reduce those emission , siegel say .
'' there be no requirement to trace any molecule of ddt to the thin of bald eagle egg just as there be no requirement to trace any molecule of carbon dioxide to the death of any particular polar bear , '' she say .
in california , the requirement to consult with government biologist before construction project be particularly crucial , say mark rockwell , california state representative of the endanger species coalition , a alliance of 50 environmental , business , hunting and fish and religious group in the state .
the u.s. forest service approve log plan that might affect coastal coho salmon and steelhead , marbled murrelet and pacific fisher on national forest .
the u.s. army corps of engineer give permit for fill wetland .
without the requirement , there be no incentive for the agency to seek consultation and a biological opinion , rockwell say .
for example , the bureau of reclamation be force by the current requirement to seek biological opinion on whether the amount of water be divert from the southern part of the sacramento-san joaquin river delta would hurt the delta smell or harm chinook salmon .
protection find lack .
environmental group challenge opinion that water flow for the fish be adequate , and win decision agree that the protection be indeed lack in the plan .
'' it be the biological opinion that lead to the challenge , '' rockwell say .
'' if you do not have a opinion , you have nothing to challenge . '' .
under the new regulation , the federal agency would have the discretion of decide whether or not to ask for a consultation and opinion , rockwell say .
april 27 , 2009 . .
biologist call on obama administration to overturn bush rule that cut science out of endanger species legislation .
interior and commerce secretary must act by may 9 .
more than 1 , 300 federal and independent scientist with biological expertise and three lead scientific society today call on the interior and commerce department to overturn rule change make in january that weaken the scientific foundation of the endanger species act .
in a letter , the scientist urge the department secretary to rescind change to endanger species act regulation that allow federal agency to decide for themselves if they own project as road , dam and mine threaten imperil species .
previously , federal agency be require to consult with biologist at the u . s . fish and wildlife service or national marine fishery service before undertake or permit project .
many federal agency do not have the scientific expertise to determine the consequence of federal project on endanger species and may have vest interest in the implementation of a project , '' say stuart pimm , dori duke professor of conservation ecology at duke university , who help organize the scientist letter .
the new rule exclude expert scientist for decade have provide impartial review and critical analysis the process . '' .
the ornithological council , society for conservation biology and the wildlife society , which collectively represent more than 20 , 000 scientist , also send a letter today ask the interior and commerce secretary to rescind the change and make other improvement to the scientific base of the endanger species act .
as the threat we face continue to evolve , federal scientist must be able to evaluate they consequence for imperil species .
put boundary on the science that inform the endanger species act fundamentally undermine the ability of science and scientist to protect we nation biodiversity , '' say alan thornhill , a ecologist and executive director of the society for conservation biology .
politics play a huge role in such decision , '' say michael hutchin , executive director and ceo of the wildlife society .
expert review and oversight be critical . '' .
the rule generate concern when they be hastily push through at the end of the last administration with little discussion or debate .
the obama administration have address the rule change , but have not formally overturn it .
on march 3 , president obama direct the commerce and interior department to review it , state that we should be look at way to strengthen -lsb- the endanger species act -rsb- not weaken it . '' .
president obama also direct federal agency to continue consult with scientist on project that might harm endanger species .

a provision in a omnibus spending bill sign by president obama on march 11 allow interior secretary ken salazar and commerce secretary gary locke to rescind the rule change within 60 day .
secretary salazar have say publicly that he be concern about the rule change , but have not indicate that he will act by the may 9 deadline .
on friday , it be report that the interior department send a rule to the white house office of management and budget that address the interagency review process but not other part of the rule that the scientist want repeal , particularly the limit on what kind of information can be use in determine how to protect the polar bear .
the content of the rule be not release .
the two letter also urge the administration to take a more comprehensive look at how science can better inform decision - make under the endanger species act .
accord to the scientist , other recent change create unrealistic deadline for scientific consultation and limit the type of information federal scientist can consider when evaluate federal project .
these change chop down the role of science in governmental decision - make , leave less than a stump behind .
the loss of science translate into real loss of biodiversity , '' say francesca grifo , a biodiversity expert and director of the union of concerned scientist scientific integrity program .

the bush administration issue two late-term regulation on thursday that environmentalist say weaken federal protection for endanger species but that interior department official defend as block a '' back-door '' attempt to regulate emission that contribute to global warming .

previously , federal agency be require to consult with scientist who specialize in particular species before proceed with a project like a road or dam .
the project could not go forward unless the specialist certify that no harm would come to endanger plant or wildlife .
the rule announce thursday would allow federal agency to bypass those scientist in some case if the agency determine that the endanger species would not be harm .
the revision be finalize after four month of deliberation and over the objection of what official say be the bulk of nearly 235,000 public comment on the change .
the update rule also bar agency from stop a project because its emission might contribute to global warming .
opponent call the change particularly objectionable for the polar bear , which have see its habitat shrink as arctic ice cap melt .
the government declare polar bear a threaten species this year .

he stress that agency could still consult with species scientist if they choose , and he reiterate he belief that climate change regulation be a '' wholly inappropriate use of the endanger species act . '' .
kempthorne acknowledge internal debate over the change , but he and other administration official say they tweak the rule in response to public comment .

interior , commerce department overturn rule that cut science out of endanger species act .
statement by francesca grifo .
today , interior secretary ken salazar rescind eleventh - hour bush administration change to endanger species act regulation that allow federal agency to decide for themselves if they own project as road and would threaten imperil species .
federal agency again will be require to consult with expert biologist at the u . s . fish and wildlife service or national marine fishery service before undertake or permit new project .
the rule change be just one of several controversial bush administration action that undermine the scientific foundation of the endanger species act , accord to the union of concerned scientist -lrb- uc -rrb- .
in a related story , 1 , 300 biologist and three scientific society represent some 20 , 000 scientist send separate letter last friday to the interior and commerce department urge they to overturn the last - minute bush rule change .
below be a statement by francesca grifo , director of ucs scientific integrity program .
several last - minute bush administration regulatory change have undermine the scientific foundation of the endanger species act , and today the obama administration have begin to repair the damage .
the message from ten of thousand of scientist around the country be clear : these unwarranted change fundamentally undermine we ability to protect imperil plant and animal .
today , the obama administration restore critical check and balance to protect we nation biodiversity .
interior secretary salazar decision be a long - await first step .
but there be much more to be do .
the obama administration must thoroughly review how science be use to ensure that we nation imperil species have a chance to survive thrive . '' .
the we interior and commerce department report dec. 11 final propose change to the endanger species act , which interior secretary dirk a. kempthorne say be not as extensive as originally plan .
'' the rule strengthen the regulation so the government can focus on protect endanger species as it strive to rebuild the american economy , '' kempthorne say .
'' it have be revise since it be propose in august because the public make suggestion we could use to improve it , '' he say .
the propose change be schedule to appear in the dec. 12 federal register .
'' what we be do be clarify the threshold for consultation to occur .
if science can not draw a direct causal link between a action and a effect on a list species , as be currently the case for global process like climate change , than consultation under the esa be not necessary , '' kempthorne maintain .
congressional critic and environmental organization immediately criticize the proposal .
'' the bush administration appear to be determine to use every last minute in office to wreak as much havoc as possible on we nation , '' say edward j. markey -lrb- d-mass -rrb- , chairman of the house select committee on energy independence and global warming .
'' today 's announcement that they will be remove fish and wildlife expert from key decision to protect the safety of iconic animal like the polar bear from global warming 's effect be absurd and a recipe for disaster , '' markey say .
andrew wetzler , director of the natural resource defense council 's endanger species program , comment .
'' this administration have reject anything with a whiff of science , so before skulk out the back door they be go after rule that require -lsb- we -rsb- fish and wildlife service scientist to prevent harm to we last wild animal and place .
despite today 's feel-good statement , we remain convinced that these change be illegal .
we will look at the final language when it be publish tomorrow , but i think we will see they in court . '' .
scope of exception .
but kempthorne note that federal agency would be require to follow exist consultation procedure except in specific , limited instance where a propose action be not expect to have adverse impact on any member of a esa-listed species and would satisfy one of the following condition .
it must be wholly beneficial , have no effect on a list species or its critical habitat , have effect which could not be measure or detect in a manner that permit meaningful evaluation , or it must be the result of global process that can not be reliably predict or measure on the scale of the species ' current range .
agency still would be able to voluntarily engage in the consultation process , the secretary emphasize .
he say the final propose regulation contain fewer opportunity for agency to proceed without consultation than what be originally envision .
nothing in the proposal require that a federal agency bypass consultation , nor do it preclude any federal agency from seek the expertise of the fish and wildlife service and the national marine fishery service or from take advantage of expertise that may be available from state and local agency , university , nongovernment organization , or other source , accord to kempthorne .
any federal agency may avail itself of expertise offer by fw and nmf in exactly the same manner as under current regulation if it determine it have any limitation to make determination under the esa or believe that it do not have the scientific expertise to make a accurate assessment of a project 's impact on list species and critical habitat , he say .
moreover , nothing in the proposal relieve a agency of its responsibility to ensure that list species be not harm during completion of a federal action , regardless of whether consultation occur or not , kempthorne say .
in case where a action agency determine that consultation be not require and harm to a list species result , full civil and criminal penalty , as lay out by other section of the esa , remain in effect , he indicate .
obama reverse bush on species protection measure .
march 04 , 2009 .
in a move that will subject a number of government project to enhance environmental and scientific scrutiny , president obama be restore a requirement that u . s . agency consult with independent federal expert to determine whether they action might harm threaten and endanger species .
the presidential memorandum issue yesterday , which mark yet another reversal of former president george w . bush environmental legacy , will revive a decade - old practice under the endanger species act that call for agency to consult with either the fish and wildlife service or the national oceanic and atmospheric administration on whether they project could affect imperil species .
on dec . 16 , the bush administration allow agency to waive such review if they decide , on they own , that the action would not harm vulnerable plant and animal .

in the meantime , accord to the memorandum , official should follow the prior longstanding consultation and concurrence practice that call for independent review .
the work of scientist and expert in my administration , include here at the interior department , will be respect , '' obama say .
with smart , sustainable policy , we can grow we economy today and preserve the environment . '' .
environmentalist and scientist welcome the move , but business official say it could delay federally funded project that could help revive the nation economy : all of they agree it would prompt a second look at several initiative adopt by the bush administration in its final month in office .
earthjustice lawyer janette brimmer , whose group have challenge the bush rule in federal district court in california , say she expect that the new administration would reexamine two pend project : a bureau of land management plan for oversee oregon forest , which be finalize on dec . 30 and could affect protected species such as the northern spotted owl ; and construction of the white pine coal - fire power plant in nevada .

after year of scientific scandal , the interior department and its partner agency need desperately to regain credibility by make decision with honesty , clarity and transparency , '' grifo say .
but william l . kovac , the u . s . chamber of commerce vice president of environment , technology and regulatory affair , say that revive another layer of review will result in even greater delay to project - - include stimulus - back , job - create project - - as agency now grapple with the prospect of lengthy interagency consultation to determine , for instance , if a bridge project in florida contribute to the melting of arctic ice .
this be such a departure from the spirit and the letter of the endanger species act that we wonder if the law drafter would even recognize it today . '' .
the latest policy shift follow several other administration action revamp environmental policy , include a reexamination of fuel economy standard and offshore oil drilling ; a new review of whether to grant california and other state the right to regulate greenhouse - gas emission from vehicle ; and the endorsement of a new international treaty negotiation on global mercury emission .
house natural resource committee chairman nick j . rahall ii -lrb- d - w . va . -rrb- , who have be seek to overturn bush endanger species rule through legislation , call the announcement one more indication that the new administration truly represent change for the better and be commit to the protection of we natural resource and we environment . official say the move be unlikely to trigger broad use of the endanger species act to regulate greenhouse - gas emission .
while the bush rule specifically prohibit endanger species consultation on the basis of global process such as climate change , a interior official speaking on the condition of anonymity say that under the new policy , such a review would be trigger only if scientific evidence suggest a causal connection between emission from a federal project and its effect on a imperil species or a identifiable part of its habitat .
