obama administration flip bush endanger species ruling .
04 / 28 / 09 07 : 35 pm et .
federal agency again will have to consult with government wildlife expert before take action that could have a impact on threaten or endanger species .
the obama administration say tuesday it be overturn a rule change make in the final week of the bush presidency .
official at the interior and commerce department say they have reimpose the consultation requirement that assure the government top biologist involve in species protection will have a say in federal action that could harm plant , animal and fish that be at risk of extinction .
such consultation have be require for more than two decade until the bush administration make it optional in rule issue last december , just week before the change in administration .
environmentalist argue that the change severely reduce the protection afford under the federal endangered species act .
by roll back this eleventh - hour regulation , we be ensure that threaten and endanger species continue to receive the full protection of the law and that top science will be the foundation of the decision making , say interior secretary ken salazar .
commerce secretary gary locke add : we decision affirm the administration commitment to use sound science to promote conservation and protect the environment . '' .
agency in the two department share responsibility for managing and enforce the endanger species act and employ the government top scientist in species protection .
in march , president barack obama issue a executive order put the bush rule change on hold .
congress follow by give specific authorization for the interior and commerce department to revoke the action , avoid a long and complicated regulatory process .
environmentalist widely praise tuesday action , but some express dismay that salazar do also rescind a rule that limit the protection to the polar bear , which last year be declare as threaten under the endanger species act because of disappear arctic sea ice as a result of climate change .
the bush administration issue a rule that prohibit a agency from take into account indirect adverse impact on the polar bear from activity outside of the arctic region : for example carbon dioxide emission that be link to global warming and , therefore , the loss of arctic sea ice .
congress authorize that rule to be revoke as well , but the interior department say no decision have yet be make on the matter .
from we perspective the job be half do , '' say noah greenwald of the center for biological diversity , a advocacy group .
the polar bear arctic sea ice habitat be melt away .
if the -lrb- bush -rrb- special rule be not strike down the polar bear be likely to be the first large mammal to go extinct due to global warming in the united state . '' .
the end of the long - standing requirement _ date back to 1986 _ of interagency consultation with the interior and commerce agency on endanger species protection produce a firestorm in both congress and within the environmental and conservation community .
for year , agency involve in thousand of federal activity _ from issue clean air rule to approve highway or dam construction _ have have to consult not only they own expert but also biologist at the u . s . fish and wildlife service or the national oceanic and atmospheric administration to ensure the activity do not harm plant , animal or fish that be protect by the endanger species act .
developer and business group argue that the consultation cause unneeded delay and increase the cost of project .
the bush administration make the independent consultation optional , argue that it be a minor shift in policy .
one impetus for the rule change be concern by the bush administration that the endanger species act might be use as a back door to regulate greenhouse gas as a way to combat climate change .
the interior department earlier have declare the polar bear a threaten species because of the loss of arctic sea ice , a change attribute to global warming .
salazar and lock say the two department will jointly decide if any change be need to improve the interagency consultation procedure .
the fish and wildlife service , which be part of the interior department , have jurisdiction over plant and animal , while noaa , part of the commerce department , deal with fish species that be at risk of extinction .
just six week before president-elect barack obama take office , the bush administration issue revise endanger species regulation thursday to reduce the input of federal scientist and to block the law from be use to fight global warming .
the change , which will go into effect in about 30 day , be complete in just four month .
but they could take obama much longer to reverse .
they will eliminate some of the mandatory , independent review that government scientist have perform for 35 year on dam , power plant , timber sale and other project , a step that developer and other federal agency have blame for delay and cost increase .
the rule also prohibit federal agency from evaluate the effect on endanger species and the place they live from a project 's contribution to increase global warming .
interior department official describe the change as '' narrow , '' but admit that the regulation be controversial inside the agency .
environmentalist view they as erode the protection for endanger species .
interior official say federal agency could still seek the expertise of federal wildlife biologist on a voluntary basis , and that other part of the law will ensure that species be protect .
'' nothing in this regulation relieve a federal agency of its responsibility to ensure that species be not harm , '' say interior secretary dirk kempthorne in a conference call with reporter .
current rule require biologist in the fish and wildlife service and national marine fishery service to sign off on project even when it be determine that they be not likely to harm species .
the rule finalize thursday would do away with that requirement , reduce the number of consultation so that the government 's expert can focus on case that pose the greatest harm to wildlife , official say .
but environmentalist say that the rule change would put decision about endanger species into the hand of agency with a vested interest in advance a project and with little expertise about wildlife .
several environmental group file a lawsuit in federal court in san francisco hour after the rule 's announcement .
jamie rappaport clark , a former director of the fish and wildlife service and a vice president of defender of wildlife , say thursday that the change target the '' absolute heart of the endanger species act . '' .
clark tell a house hearing on the bush administration 's last-minute environmental regulation that these change remove '' a system of check and balance that provide a essential safety net for imperil animal and plant . '' .
between 1998 and 2002 , the fish and wildlife service conduct 300,000 consultation .
the national marine fishery service , which evaluate project affect marine species , conduct about 1,300 review each year .
the review have help safeguard protected species such as bald eagle , florida panther and whoop crane .
a federal government handbook from 1998 describe the consultation as '' some of the most valuable and powerful tool to conserve list species . '' .
the bush administration work diligently to get the change in place before obama take over , corral 15 expert in washington in october to sort through 250,000 write comment from the public on the revision in 32 hour .
obama have say he would work to reverse the change .
but because the rule take effect before he be swear in , he would have to restart the lengthy rulemaking process .
house natural resource committee chairman rep. nick rahall , d-w , say he would seek to overturn the regulation use the congressional review act after consult with other democratic leader .
the rarely use law allow congress to review new federal regulation .
congress have oppose similar change to the endanger species protection in the past .
in 2003 , the bush administration impose similar rule that would have allow agency to approve new pesticide and wildfire reduction project without seek the opinion of government scientist .
the pesticide rule be later overturn in court .
the interior department , along with the forest service , be currently be sue over the rule govern wildfire prevention .
in 2005 , the house pass a bill that would have make similar change to the endanger species act , but the bill die in the senate .
oklahoma sen. jame inhofe , the lead republican on the senate environment and public work committee , say in a statement the new regulation be '' common-sense change to a law much overdue for reform . '' .
there be a handful of other environmental regulation still pend before bush leaf office , include a rule to exempt large agricultural operation from report release of ammonia and other hazardous air pollutant .
they must be finalize by dec. 19 in order for they go into effect before jan. 20 .
in a related development , the interior department also finalize thursday a special rule for the polar bear , a species that be list as threaten in may because of global warming .
the rule would allow oil and gas exploration in area where the bear live , as long as the company comply with the marine mammal protection act .
obama administration overturn rule that weaken endanger species act .
april 28 , 2009 .
interior secretary ken salazar announce today that the obama administration will reverse a endanger species act -lrb- esa -rrb- regulation that allow federal agency to go ahead with action that may impact endanger species without consult with expert , essentially circumvent the role of conservation scientist in such decision .
by roll back this eleventh - hour regulation , we be ensure that threaten and endanger species continue to receive the full protection of the law say salazar .
the change to the esa be make last december by the bush administration and draw heavy criticism from environmental and conservation group .
at the time , during heavy campaigning , obama state that he oppose the last minute rule change with a spokesman state : '' as president , senator obama will fight to maintain the strong protection of the endanger species act and undo this proposal from president bush . '' .
darin schroeder , vice president for conservation advocacy at the environmental organization , american bird conservancy , agree with salazar '' s decision .
'' we be gratified secretary salazar and secretary locke act to restore the endanger species act to its intended strength .
the consultation process be one of the cornerstone of the esa , and one of the key check and balance that ensure protection for the 90 bird and 1 , 263 other animal and plant it cover . '' .
another anticipate ruling regard polar bear have not be announce yet .
while the bush administration find that melt ice in the arctic due to climate change be endanger polar bear , they rule that the esa could not use to regulate carbon emission in order to protect the polar bear .
salazar must make a judgment on this rule by may 9th .
'' secretary salazar take a important step today toward restore need protection for endanger species , '' say noah greenwald , biodiversity program director for the center for biological diversity .
'' but he still need to rescind the special rule for the polar bear , which amount to a death sentence for the majestic bear because it exempt greenhouse gas emission from regulation . '' .
the bush administration on thursday eliminate 35-year-old regulation in the endanger species act that require a independent scientific review of propose federal project to determine whether they imperil protected plant and animal .
instead , federal agency undertake project like road and power plant construction or oil and gas drilling will make they own assessment .
without the independent review , such project could be accelerate .
as part of the change announce by interior secretary dirk kempthorne in the final day of the bush administration , the department finalize a interim rule that allow oil and gas drilling in polar bear habitat off alaska 's coast .
the rule change be design to prevent the endanger species act from be use to regulate greenhouse gas emission , essentially make climate change policy .
kempthorne , who characterize the new rule as a common-sense streamlining of bureaucratic process , acknowledge that there be disagreement within the department regard the rule , which take effect in 30 day .
under current law , agency must submit any plan that could harm species on the endanger list for review by scientist at the u.s. fish and wildlife service , which enforce the endanger species act .
the process have be criticize by home builder group and the oil and gas industry for delay costly project .
the consultation requirement be intend as more than just a check and balance .
jamie rappaport clark , executive vice president of defender of wildlife and director of fish and wildlife under president clinton , say the consultation process resolve the problem of '' mission conflict '' between agency .
the department of defense , for example , might not understand why a endanger plant should be consider when expand a bombing range .
'' the problem be the agency do not always properly consider , understand or protect species in they habitat because they be focus on the pursuit of they primary mission , '' clark say .
'' it be hard for the biologist to satisfy they responsibility to protect species if the agency perceive it affect they primary mission . '' .
president-elect barack obama say he would reverse the rule change , as have some member of congress .
but that require a lengthy rule-making process .
in the house , member can invoke the rarely use congressional review act to overturn the regulation .
'' these change be go to result in more species be put in jeopardy , '' clark say .
'' but more importantly , we be not go to know what we do not know anymore . '' .
official say agency would still be hold liable if they approve project that harm threaten or endanger species .
kempthorne also note that any federal agency could choose to informally consult with the fish and wildlife service at any time .
h. dale hall , director of fish and wildlife , say he have concern about how fast the estimate 235,000 public comment be process .
staff assign to the job spend eight hour a day tabulate the comment .
work under strict time restraint , agency employee have nine seconds to read each letter , accord to one calculation .
official say that more than 200,000 of the comment oppose the rule change .
attempt to revise the endanger species act have be rebuff by congress in recent year .
sen. barbara boxer -lrb- d-calif -rrb- say thursday 's action be another assault on the law .
'' these midnight regulation be part of a continue effort by the bush administration to repeal we landmark environmental law through the back door and weaken protection for we nation 's endanger species , '' she say in a statement .
'' i believe they be illegal , and if similar regulation have be in place , they would have undermine we ability to protect the bald eagle , the grizzly bear and the gray whale , '' boxer say .
environmental group , which take the administration to court to force it to list the polar bear , vow to continue the legal battle .
three group , the center for biological diversity , greenpeace and defender of wildlife , file suit in san francisco hour after the change be announce , argue that the regulation fail to follow the public review process .
'' the bush administration have repackage the same old lump of coal as a holiday present for the polar bear , and once again hand its friend in the oil industry a huge gift , '' say kassie siegel , climate program director at the center for biological diversity and lead author of the 2005 petition to list polar bear .
'' these regulation seem design to drive the polar bear extinct . '' .
the rule regard polar bear come seven month after that animal become the first to be place on the endanger species list primarily because of global climate change .
the melting of sea ice be threaten the polar bear with extinction .
this summer , score of polar bear be observe swimming in open sea , far from land or ice floe .
but kempthorne say that he would not allow the 1973 law to be use as a '' back door for implement climate-change policy . '' .
to that end , he clarify regulation address threat to polar bear habitat : greenhouse emission from automobile , power plant and other human activity .
the act require federal agency to designate habitat critical to the creature 's survival , then protect it by strict enforcement .
kempthorne say that accord to he reading , court ruling require pinpoint a specific source of a threat to habitat -- something that he say be scientifically impossible .
that interpretation of the court ' opinion give the government few option to protect polar bear habitat .
president obama overturn endanger species rule bush instate .
former president bush have enact legislation that could have put more animal in danger .
mar 4 , 2009 .
in a move that could anger some people on the other side of the aisle , president obama overturn a administration regulation that could have possibly weaken the stability of the endanger species act .
before former president george w . bush left office , he pass legislation that would have allow federal agency to skip consultation before launch project that could affect endanger wildlife .
this could have put more animal at risk , and while it would have eliminate a lot of red tape in the process , it could have be more risky to endanger animal than necessary .
the problem with the legislation by bush be that it be take scientist out of the equation , and basically remove the most knowledgeable people from the equation .
it would have give a lot of additional power to federal agency , but strip a lot of the rights that the endanger species act give to the animal which it seek to protect .
while the act be not perfect in its implementation or enforcement , undermine by remove any tooth that it might have be a big step in the wrong direction .
president obama have already receive immense support from environmentalist for this move , and by overturn something the bush administration put in place , he show that he be also willing to step up to the plate on issue such as these .
by flat out declare that it be necessary to ensure that no harm will come to endanger species as the result of new project , it give the endanger species act more strength , and do a lot to further the cause of environmentalist look to protect these animal .
with scientist be put back into the equation , it give a lot of hope that the threaten wildlife will stand a better chance at survive over the long term .
it be a questionable move when bush make the move to approve the last - minute legislation during he second term , and while there be a lot of objection , nothing could really be do at the time .
with a eye toward the future , president obama make a really smart decision by bring scientist back into the endanger species fold , and surely help to save a number of animal that could have otherwise be put at risk .
in a move environmental group say strike at the heart of the endanger species act , the bush administration on thursday announce a new rule that would let federal agency decide on they own whether they project harm endanger species , instead of require they in many case to get a second opinion from federal wildlife expert .
biologist call on obama administration to overturn bush rule that cut science out of endanger species decision .
interior and commerce secretary must act by may 9 .
washington - april 27 - .
more than 1 , 300 federal and independent scientist with biological expertise and three lead scientific society today call on the interior and commerce department to overturn rule change make in january that weaken the scientific foundation of the endanger species act .
in a letter , the scientist urge the department secretary to rescind change to endanger species act regulation that allow federal agency to decide for themselves if they own project - - such as road , dam and mine - - would threaten imperil species .
previously , federal agency be require to consult with biologist at the u . s . fish and wildlife service or national marine fishery service before undertake or permit project .
many federal agency do not have the scientific expertise to determine the consequence of federal project on endanger species and may have vest interest in the implementation of a project , '' say stuart pimm , dori duke professor of conservation ecology at duke university , who help organize the scientist letter .
the new rule exclude expert scientist - - who for decade have provide impartial review and critical analysis - - from the process . '' .
the ornithological council , society for conservation biology and the wildlife society , which collectively represent more than 20 , 000 scientist , also send a letter today ask the interior and commerce secretary to rescind the change and make other improvement to the scientific base of the endanger species act .
as the threat we face continue to evolve , federal scientist must be able to evaluate they consequence for imperil species .
put boundary on the science that inform the endanger species act fundamentally undermine the ability of science and scientist to protect we nation biodiversity , '' say alan thornhill , a ecologist and executive director of the society for conservation biology .
politics play a huge role in such decision , '' say michael hutchin , executive director and ceo of the wildlife society .
expert review and oversight be critical . '' .
the rule generate concern when they be hastily push through at the end of the last administration with little discussion or debate .
the obama administration have address the rule change , but have not formally overturn it .
on march 3 , president obama direct the commerce and interior department to review it , state that we should be look at way to strengthen -lsb- the endanger species act -rsb- - - not weaken it . '' .
president obama also direct federal agency to continue consult with scientist on project that might harm endanger species .
congress also have take step to address the problem .
a provision in a omnibus spending bill sign by president obama on march 11 allow interior secretary ken salazar and commerce secretary gary locke to rescind the rule change within 60 day .
secretary salazar have say publicly that he be concern about the rule change , but have not indicate that he will act by the may 9 deadline .
on friday , it be report that the interior department send a rule to the white house office of management and budget that address the interagency review process but not other part of the rule that the scientist want repeal , particularly the limit on what kind of information can be use in determine how to protect the polar bear .
the content of the rule be not release .
the two letter also urge the administration to take a more comprehensive look at how science can better inform decision - make under the endanger species act .
accord to the scientist , other recent change create unrealistic deadline for scientific consultation and limit the type of information federal scientist can consider when evaluate federal project .
these change chop down the role of science in governmental decision - make , leave less than a stump behind .
the loss of science translate into real loss of biodiversity , '' say francesca grifo , a biodiversity expert and director of the union of concerned scientist scientific integrity program .
the new rule weaken the scientific foundation of the endanger species act and make it easier to base decision on politics instead of science .
in give the department the authority to roll back these rule , congress have give the american people a gift , and the department secretary need to open it . '' .
